"Heard it? We saw the whole thang," says Apple Bloom


"Think she might actually be trying to turn him into a girl?" Sweetie Belle jokes.


"Could be. You're practically one already by the way you were screamin' like a filly back there; 'Wha-, Rarity! Aah! Aaah!Aaaah! What are you doing?! Stop it! Stop it!' " she mimics mockingly with her high-pitched and girly caricature of your voice.


"Hey, I resent that!" You stop and turn around. "I do not scream like a filly! I'll have you know that I scream like a full grown mare." You cross you arms and plaster a smug smile on your face. The two filly's giggle at your self deprecation right as your phone starts ringing. You pull your phone out and are about to answer when you add, "And I would like to see what you would do if a corset was gonna crush you like a vice." You turn around and continue walking. "Hello?"


"Hi, [your name]," answered Twilight. "What was that about a corset?" Oops, had your phone on when you said that.


"Nothing, just one of Rarity's things. So what's up? We're basically right outside Fluttershy's house right now."


"Oh, really? Well, I was just calling to tell you that we got everything under control and that you didn't have to come over, if you didn't want to."


"Alright, cool," you say, happy that they got things done though irritated at this pointless and long journey. "So are you leaving right now?"


"Well, actually me and Fluttershy have got a fun game going on," Twilight said with enthusiasm. "You and the girls can still join us if you want."


"Okay," you agree. After all, it was either Fluttershy's or dink around town. A minute later you are on the doorstep and let yourself in. Fluttershy and Twilight are on the living room floor playing...
1231.title: Sweet Apple Acres

12312.content:
Twilight and Fluttershy are kneeling on the floor surrounded by mounds of cloth, every so often picking through the selection to hold a dress to their chests to imagine themselves in it.


"What's going on in here?" you ask as you approach with Apple Bloom and Sweetie Bell in tow.


"Oh, hi [your name]," Fluttershy says. "Well, Twilight and I actually finished quite early and I decided to do a little cleaning. We just going through my wardrobe—"


"Fluttershy had a lot of clothes in her closet," Twilight interjects, gesturing to the piles of clothing, "most of them she made herself!"


"Well, we were just going to be reorganizing when we decided—"


"—To have play dress up!" Twilight squeals in delight.


Your eye twitches. "Duah-duh-dress up?" you stammer.


"We've even got some clothes from when I was smaller, if the girls want to play," Fluttershy says more to Apple Bloom and Sweetie Belle than you.


"That could be fun," answers Sweetie Belle. "What do you say Apple Bloom?"


"Alright," Apple Bloom agrees, "maybe we could get our cutie marks in modelin'."


"You can definitely help us out, [your name]," Twilight holds up a corset. Nope. No. Nah-uh. Not gonna happen.


"Whoa, look at the time," you say, looking at your non-existent wristwatch, "I just remebered that we have something really important to do. Gotta go; duty calls!" You grab both Apple Bloom's and Sweetie Belles tails, halting their advance. "Let's go!" You pull lightly as not to hurt them.


"But we just got here," Sweetie Belle reasons.


"Yeah, and you had nothin' planned ta to in town anyway," Apple Bloom says wryly, turning around and yanking both her's and Sweetie Belle's tails from your hands. You stumble backwards and fall over, rather intentionally.


"No!" you gasp, grasping the air and writhing around. "Can't breath! Must escape!"


You begin to crawl for the door, all the while making hacking and wheezing noises, making you journey seem agonizing.


"Estrogen levels *cough* toxic! Contamination...*wheeze* reaching critical mass!" You pull yourself up and stagger to the door opening. "Must...find... a gym...stat!" You open the door and yelp in surprise only to fall down again. The moment you looked out a face is right there, startling you.


"Heya Scaredy-Cat!" says Pinkie Pie in one of her bouts of randomness, "though you're more of a scaredy and less of a cat. Hahaha! I was just thinking how boreed you must be doing all this hard work on a Friday—" Pinkie's lips speed away at a mile a minute as she explains her entire thought process from the moment you left Sugarcube to this moment, all the while wildly gesticulating in big circles across Fluttershy's yard. You pick yourself up and as your initial bewilderment passes you stand there impassive while Pinkie wrapped things up: "—and so when I found my pogo sticks I totally thought 'hey, [your name] should have fun with pogo sticks too!' " She had been bouncing around the lawn for a few seconds now. "So whaddaya say? How 'bout we take these babies for a hop around town? A-boingy-boingy-boingy-boi—"


*SLAM*


"I'm in," you announce.

============================================

You were sort of uninterested at first when Twilight and Fluttershy stated that this game had some reasons behind it, so you didn't ask more about them. There was something about a traveling festival that had just been scheduled yesterday to take place in Ponyville next week. That was why you had not heard of it along with most everypony else in Ponyville. Except your friends. As it turns out, Pinkie Pie's new recipe is to be a sensation with all the pony's that will be coming in from out of town, Applejack is hauling in a ton of apples to bake a ton of concessions by a certain deadline, Rarity is to making sure there is enough fancy get-up to go around, while Twilight and Fluttershy are just deciding what to wear to the event.


"So, uh, why do you need a dress to go to a festival?" you inquire as you laze on Fluttershy's couch.


"Despite it being a festival, it is actually a well-organized event that is semi-formal at times," explains Twilight. "This year, the theme is "Tartarus and Elysium", which will span three days. "Tartarus" will be on the first day and be the hectic and wild party while "Elysium" is on the last day and it will be a more formal and refined party."


"That sounds weird," you state. "It's something new, isn't it?"


"Yes, actually. Though it has been around for only a few years, it's been getting more and more popular and taking place in bigger and bigger towns. I'd say we're lucky it's taking place right here in Ponyville. How would this dress look?" Twilight asks, holding up a green dress.


"It's not really your color," you say, serving your purpose as the artistic opinion. At least your not a "model" like you almost were. "Why are you choosing from Fluttershy's wardrobe and not ordering another custom from Rarity?"


"She's swamped with orders and stocks to fill as it is. There's no need to make her job any harder than it already is."


"Right, okay, yeah, that makes sense," you agree.


Fluttershy steps from the other room as she was trying on the dresses first. She has on a red strapless, single-piece dress that fit her form to the very last curve. Her hands are clenched behind her back and her eyes were downcast nervously as she smiles while blushing. "H-how do I look?" she asks. She looked really pretty in that dress, but the color was quite a contrast and you doubt she'd wear something so revealing anyway so you move on.


"Try the green one," you suggest, pointing to the dress Twilight held in her hands.


Once Fluttershy was back in the other room you ask, "So why are you so concentrated on the "Elysium" day? Tartarus is sure to have some excellent bands with some great moshes. Dress in the black and silver? Or how about the middle second day? "The Meadows" will have some awesome raves going on; I'm sure that DJ that you like will be playing."


"Yeah," Twilight giggles at your laid-back enthusiasm as it began to show, "but the "Elysium" will have an outdoor dance." Twilight leans towards you, "Y'know, one with slow songs for two."


"I don't know how to tango."


"Oh, come on! It's the best time to go on a date!" She nudges your shoulder with her elbow.


You smirk knowing Twilight must just be teasing. "Are you asking me out, Twilight?"


"Wha—? No!" She giggles. "I already have a date!"


"Huh?" you falter. "Who—wha—really?"


"Yeah," Twilight says, ignorant to your sudden discomfort. "I know I never told you about him before, but I met this great guy in the Chess Club. Ooh," she claps in excitement, "you should let Fluttershy tell you how she and her date first met!"


Speaking of which, Fluttershy steps out in the green dress, much more confidently. She twirls around for her own enjoyment, dillying long enough for Sweetie Belle and Apple Bloom to make their big entrance before you with a loud "TAA-DAA" dressed in the most atrocious combinations only for a trip over Apple Bloom's hoof to send them into a sprawling disaster.


"How do I look?" Fluttershy smiles.


You sigh and give a thumbs up.

============================================

Time passes slowly, but it eventually gets late and you set out to drop off Sweetie Belle at her parent's and lastly Apple Bloom at the Sweet Apple acres. You feel a little down on your way back up to town as you just trudge across the dirt road with your hands in your pockets, listening to the scrape of your shoes whenever they drag across the ground.


Spike is still at the library; you kind of feel like talking to him. But then you remember Pinkie Pie. She always has a way to make anyone feel better, and besides, you probably should make sure that she isn't hurt about you brushing her off back at Fluttershy's.


You think a little more about it while kicking at a rock, rolling it down the road. Once your entertainment makes an errant bounce into the bushes you finally decide to
12312.title: Dance If You Wanna

123122.content:
I should head home, you think to yourself.
Pinkie Pie will either be sleeping or working on those recipes of hers and I've gotta hit the hay.

You start to walk back to the library and begin thinking about this Tartarus/Elysium dance, sounds fun, but who would you go with?
Normally, you would just go with Twilight as friends to this sort of thing, since you and she normally didn't have anyone to go with and now she has a date.

"Maybe I'll go by myself, see how it plays out. Can't really be following Twilight and her date around the whole time" you say to yourself
"Wouldn't want to spoil it for them. Come to think of it, this is the first time I have heard of Twilight going on a date with anyone." You keep thinking "I wonder who Fluttershy is taking."

Twilight didn't say who Fluttershy was going with, just to ask her how they met.
Maybe I could ask her who when I get back to the library.

You continue walking for about 10 minutes and arrive back at the library.
Lights are off, maybe Twilight's already asleep. You think to yourself.
You walk inside "I'm home" you say, not too loudly but just incase she or spike was still awake.

You flip on the lights and see that some of the furniture had been turned over and that some items had been broken or knocked over.

"What the hell happ-" you stop midsentece as a dreadful thought passed your mind "Twilight!" you call worriedly as you run up the stairs towards her room.

You keep thinking about what was happening. We're we robbed? Attacked? and most importantly, is Twilight okay?
You open the door as quickly as possible as you reach her room.

"Twilight!?" you yell as you open the door.
123122.title: Return to the Library

choices: Only a few of your friends are awake
1231221.content:
"Mmmph. [Your name]? Is that you?" grumbles a sleepy Twilight as turns on her beside light with her magic. She has yet to see the shock on your face melt away into relief because the light does not reach you at the doorway, but she does see you stumble to the nearest desk for support as the adrenaline rush left your legs weak and trembling.


"Thank Celestia," you breath a sigh of relief, "you're okay."


"[Your name], what's wrong?" Twilight sits up in her bed, looking at you with a worried expression. "Did something happen?"


"Yes! Some one broke in!" you exclaim softly with sincerity. "The library is trashed!"


"What!?" Twilight bolts upright out of bed, staring at you, your eyes confirming to her that you're not joking. She looks alarmed, but you breath another sigh of relief in knowing that she's okay and walk towards her, about to give her comfort, but she dashes past you, trotting in place with panic. "Oh no, oh no, oh no! The Elements!" she cries, charging down after that moment's hesitation. You follow her close behind, nearly tumbling down the stairs trying to keep up.


Twilight stands amongst the chaos, surveying the scene in silent horror. She sees the smashed glass case where the elements once were. They are gone.


"The books!" Twilight exclaims, pointing to the one scattered across the floor.


"The books?!" you ask incredulously, "Twilight, the Elements are gone!"


"They might not be," she says, with some assurance."Help me find the one named The Elements of Harmony."


What good would would that book do if the elements were stolen? Regardless, you began to pick up the books scattered across the ground while Twilight picked through the piles thrown onto the ground beside the shelves. Despite the Elements being gone, you were quite calm at the moment. You glanced at Twilight as she hecticly sifted through the piles of books, just happy that she was alright. Whoever had done this was in the house when she was asleep. You shiver at the thoughs of what could have happened.


The moment you righted the overturned table in the center you found the book you were looking for and called Twilight. She levitated it away before you could bring it to her. She quickly magicked through the pages, falling on a certain page with a depression, a magical pocket that held five jeweled necklaces and a tiara. The Elements of Harmony.


"Phew," Twilight smiled as she held the elements to her chest and sank to her knees. You run to her and kneel down, putting both hands on her shoulders with your arm behind her back, steadying her reassuringly. She looks up at you and explains, "I had placed an emergency teleportation spell on the Elements that in case the glass surrounding them was broken, they'd disappear and return to the Book of the Elements of Harmony."


You sit down next to Twilight, keeping you left arm around her, but resting you right on your knee and she leans into your embrace, resting her head on your shoulder. She didn't show it at first, but Twilight really had a scare. "Come on," you say, "let's get off the ground." You gently help Twilight to stand up, but she tells you that she's fine and does so on her own.


"What's going on?" came Spike's voice. He is standing at the stairs looking drowsy with his blanket still clutched in his claws. His eyes widen when he sees the state of the room. "What happened to the library? I just rearranged these books!"


"There was a break in, Spike," you inform. "Someone tried to take the Elements of Harmony."


"A break in?" he stares blankly for a moment. "My jewels!" Spike runs arms-outstretched for his hidden jewel stash in the basement, which everyone knew about. You roll your eyes heavenward


"[Your name]," Twilight spoke authoritatively now, "call our friends and tell them what happened. If they are still awake, we should let them know immediately."


"Alright, Twilight," you comply, flipping out your phone. "Sending a message to all our friends."


Twilight has her phone out as well, sending a message of her own. She turns to you when she's done. "If this turns out to be a threat against the harmony of Equestria," she says gravely, "I'll have to inform Princess Celestia about this." She turns away from you just in time to miss you cringing at that. You just hope that if it comes to that, you won't end up surrounded by a platoon of Celestia's royal guards until this thing blows over.


Nah, you think to yourself as you press "Send".
1231221.title: Get a Move On

12312211.content:
You ended up with Spike as everyone started to investigate what had happened. There wasn't much to do as Twilight had taken to levitating everything in sight from the main chamber, using some sort of tracing spell to look for fingerprints, hoofmarks, mane follicles, whatever. So far, she has nothing. Meanwhile, you, Spike, and the two friends that actually showed up--Pinkie and Applejack--split up to look for any clues yourselves. Applejack took to circling the outside perimeter, Pinkie Pie called dibs on checking the ceilings, while you and Spike checked the basement.


While it does look messier than you remember, that might be because Twilight uses it as her laboratory often enough. Test tubes, beakers, and flasks sit in groups on any flat surfaces and wires of all colors run behind the tables or sometimes just stretch across the ground, all connected to the few pieces of metallic machinery, their lights dark and the magical components vacant from energy. This is the most chaotic place in the library despite Twilight's compulsive orderly nature; you can't tell whether the thief decided to take it easy here or if this is just one of Twilight's messes. You need to ask her, because you see something out of place that she never did touch.


"Wuff iz zath?" Spike asks with his mouth full as you heave the heavy object covered by a tarp back into its upright position.


"Excuse me?" you apologize.


Spike finishes shoveling a handful of gemstones into his mouth so he could actually finish chewing and ask, "What is that?" he point to the thing under the tarp.


"Oh, this," you say, placing your hand on the rigid structure, "this is a project I had started when I was about to turn sixteen. You don't remember?" you raise an eyebrow. "I spent a lot of my time on it. Kind of made the gang upset at the time."


Spike pauses to throw a couple more jewels into his maw. "Mmph, why didn'ff foo finiff itff?"


"Well," you lean up against the object, "like I said, it made our friends a little upset, but it also affected my performance in school when I got frustrated that it wasn't going so smoothly anymore. Auntie Celeste had a talk with me about my grades and. . .yeah, I gave up on it."


Spike giggled a little at your mention of your name for Princess Celestia. Shut up, Spike, you think loudly at him.


"But anyway, Twilight never touches this thing so I think whoever was here was also down in the basement looking for something."


"So they really could've been after my jewel stash." Spike cradles the bucket in his claws.


"No, Spike, they weren't after your...ugh," you grunt in exasperation. Nobody cares about his gems, not even him, apparently, the way he keeps eating them when he still wants to have them. "I can't tell what they were after down here when they didn't take anything."


"Okay then, maybe the Elements of Harmony were they wanted," Spike concedes.


"I think at this point that's obvious. The real question now is 'who done it?' "


"Eh," Spike shrugs, "Probably some two-bit crook, evil mastermind wannabe with a hackneyed plan to take over Ponyville."


"Sounds familiar," you say contemplatively scratching your chin. You stand and move towards the stairs. "Let's just forget it. There's nothing down here."


"Well, the least we can be sure of is that if whoever did this shows their face, Twilight and the others can just blast them with the Elements' powers," the dragon says as you let him ahead of you.


"And do what? Turn them to stone or make them regress in age?" you ask with a chuckle.


"Yes," Spike answers with a laugh.


When the both of you enter the library's main chamber, Applejack and Twilight are waiting for you there. Applejack is dressed in some loose fitting jeans and a plaid jacket while Twilight is no longer in her pajamas having quickly thrown on a white button up shirt and black pants. She is pacing around the room with her eyes shut while her horn glows, holding out her right palm face down. Applejack interrupts her concentration first.


"Checked all 'round the library, Twi," she says, "no sign of anypony havin' been near here."


Suddenly you feel a tremendous impact on your shoulders. Your arms flail about as you desperately try to maintain balance. "And while Applejack searched low, I searched high!" exclaims Pinkie just before she causes you to fall flat on your chest. She jumps off just in time to remain upright and turns to look at your prone form through a magnifying lens. She was currently in her pajamas, pink with purple stripes. "No spicks, no specks, no nothin'! Except for that broken window up there."


Pinkie points skyward and everyone looks up, except you have to roll over, and see the highest window in the library opened wide with cracks in the glass and the wooden frame bent out of shape. You are just getting up when Pinkie jumps right in front of you, dons her deerstalker cap and prods you with the pipe in her hands.


"Looks like the library fell victim to a cat burglar," Pinkie Pie deduces, with a squint of her eyes. "Only he is not a cat!" She runs over to another window and says, "For as you can see, your drapes are still intact."


You can hear Twilight groan in exasperation at the antic.


"It is my belief," Pinkie continues and starts to pace while puffing at the bubbling pipe, "Is that this crime was committed by somepony with the instincts of a cat. Therefore," she stops and turns around, holding out a picture of a pony dressed as a cat, "suspect number one; a pony last seen on Nightmare Night wearing a very convincing cat costume."


"Pinkie! That was you!" you moan, clutching at your head. That was her in the picture. She went as the cat last year!


"Pinkie," Twilight chides, "I know you're just trying to lighten the mood, but I think we should be taking things a little more seriously."


"Oh, but Twilight, I was just about to make [Your name] here my assistant." Quick as lightning, Pinkie pops a bowler hat onto your head, "After all, he wasn't there to witness my skills of clue finding." She blows a stream of bubbles as she stands with her thumb and index finger on her chin, head tilted up in the contemplating detective's pose.


"With a lot of help from Twilight," you retort acerbically. You take the opportunity to pluck the pipe from Pinkie's lips. "Speaking of which," you turn your attention to Twilight, "solving a case on cake nibblers is one thing, but are you really planning on tracking down somepony who committed a break-in and entry without contacting higher authorities?"


"See," Pinkie pipes in, "he's just full of silly questions, with obvious answers." Pinkie Pie then blinks and looks at Twilight expectantly.


Twilight rolls her eyes and answers, "I don't know, [Your name]. If this an attempt on the harmony of Equestria by somepony or something powerful, it would be best to keep the number of ponies and humans," Twilight to you with a smile; you shrug, "involved to a minimum. And I'm still not sure about the 'break-in part, because that window up there was forced open from the inside."


You look up again, realizing a few nuances in the shape of the warped frame. They definitely indicated that whatever forced it open was leaving. Unless, of course, if forcing it open with magic form the outside could make it look like that as well, but that is in Twilight's field of expertise, not yours. You are getting too tired to think clearly about this anyway.


"Listen, Sugarcube," Applejack speaks up, "Ah know that you're worried an' all, but Ah don't think stayin' up and tuckerin' your mind out is not gonna get this sorted out any faster." Finally, somepony has the same idea as you.


"I guess you're right," Twilight concedes, looking as if she finally realizes that she was feeling fatigued. "But--"


Applejack raises her hand to silence her. "No 'buts' now," she insists, "the Elements are safe and sound in that little book there, so just take it with ya. Ah know y'all must be nervous to sleep in the library after this mess, so how 'bout the three of you stay at the Apple family farm's guest room?"


"Oh, thank you Applejack," Twilight says gratefully, about to take her up on the offer when Pinkie Pie interjects:


"Hold on! Sweet Apple Acres is way, way, way far away. Sugarcube Corner is just around the corner," Pinkie snickers at that last bit, "so you'll be all snuggled up in no time! You and Spike in the guest bed while [Your name] bunks with me." Pinkie Pie winks at you. You blink a few times, wondering if she meant what you think she might've meant by that.


Not wanting to let either Pinkie or AJ down, Twilight compromises. "How about Spike and me go with Applejack while [Your name] goes with Pinkie. That way everyone has their own bed." She turns to you, "What do you think?"


What do you think? Now's your chance to switch the arrangement if you wish.
12312211.title: It's Always a Mystery

choices: She's just teasing and snuggling up
She wants to take you "all the way"
123122111.content:
"Okay, sounds good, Twi," you say.

Pinkie Pie is ecstatic. "Woohoo!" she exclaims. "Looks like you're bunking with me tonight!" She hooks her arm around your own and leads you out the door, skipping along the whole way. Outside, the night air is cold and bites at your skin through your clothes. The starry sky above dimly illuminates the world around you and you can see Pinkie has no intention of stopping, but you can't leave yet. With increasing resolve you resist, eventually pulling your arm free just so you can take the moment to bid the other two ponies goodnight.


Twilight and Applejack have just left while Spike closes the door. You walk over and wrap Twilight in a tight hug. "See you tomorrow, Twilight."


She returns the embrace in silence for a moment. "[Your name]," she giggles, pushing you away firmly and crossing her arms. "I'll be fine."


"Yeah, don't worry yer head a bit there, partner," Applejack assures you. "Tough as nails, this one right here." She places a hand on Twilight's shoulder and gives her a shake as if to emphasize.


"Don't worry that cute little head of yours," reiterates Pinkie, suddenly behind you and giving your hair a rough tousling. "If you're the one who's scared of the dark, you little 'fraidy cat, you've got Pinkie Pie to keep you smiling!" With that she grabs you much more forcefully in her playful manner and gallops away with you barely able to keep upright.


"Goodnight guys!" you call to Twilight and Applejack, your fleeting view of Twilight's horn glowing and a forcefield materializing a great dome of violet aura around the entire tree that is library quickly disappearing around the corner as Pinkie presses on towards Sugarcube corner.


When the two of you arrive, the lights are off, the sweets shop having closed hours ago. The bright colors of gingerbread house-themed building were hidden in the shadows leaving only its odd shaped silhouette standing against the speckled dark blue.


Pinkie suddenly stops and turns to you. You can't see her face, but she cringes down and her next sound makes it obvious that she's putting her finger to her lips.


"Shhhhhhh."


"What? What's up?" you ask her in a whispering tone.


"We gotta keep it down when we go in," Pinkie explains quite loudly despite her whispering rasp, "see, I'm technically not supposed to have other ponies over, especially colts--" She nudges you with her elbow at the last part. You can only imagine that she winked as well in the darkness. "--The Cakes' rules and all."


"Oh, you mean over as in overnight," you specify, since you and the gang were over in Pinkie's room plenty of times for her parties, but they never were slumber parties. "Then why did you invite me over?"


"Silly," Pinkie Pie claps her hands to your cheeks and presses your faces together, forehead to forehead, nose to muzzle, "they didn't say anything about having humans or boys over!"


"Oh, I see. Taking the advantage of poor word choice in verbal agreements," you say rolling your eyes dubiously. You doubt Pinkie could see you do that despite the close proximity to her gaze.


"You got that right." She lets go of your face. "But I doubt that Mr. and Mrs. Cake will see it the way I do, so we'll sneak in anyway. Makes this feel much more. . .naughty," she spiders her fingers across your chest as she says that. You're starting to cling to a certain idea of what that the wink she gave you really meant. The idea both urges you forward while giving you apprehension as well. You stand there a moment before you have to catch up with Pinkie Pie who is already at the door.


Once inside and the door shut and locked behind you, Pinkie tippy-hooves her way up the stairs while you, despite your rubber soled sneakers, still manage to make it seem as if every floorboards underneath your feet creaks loudly. It's not that loud, but you're still paranoid, a pair of guardians with disapproval of your current act sleeping somewhere in the deadly quiet building. Even greater disapproval of what else might happen.


Still you go. Down the hall you creep, everything dark but visible to your straining eyes. You come to Pinkie's closed door, light slipping out from beneath the gap at the floor. Feeling low, you take a moment to yourself now that you aren't being ushered anywhere.


Pinkie had always been a great friend to you. When you moved to Ponyville you felt very alienated being in a new town that had never seen a human in person before. Twilight and Spike were your only friends to begin with, everyone else keeping a distance from you or a few who felt like tormenting you. Applejack quickly followed as a close friend when she stood up for you on multiple occasions.


The only pony who took a shine to you quicker was Pinkie Pie, as she did to all newcomers, so you didn't feel too special when she threw a welcoming party for you. She also prodded you a lot throughout, curious of your strange visage and attire. She meant no harm, but it was a reminder of the stares and humiliating questions you received in you classes on the first days of school. You were a tough crowd for Pinkie. Any smiles from you were forced or halfhearted at best. You didn't consider her a friend at first, merely an acquaintance. But as time when on, your depression continued to build up when you found yourself unable to open up about your problems to anyone anymore, knowing that you would be singled out for a long time to come.


What you didn't know at the time were the lengths at which Pinkie Pie would go to give you a genuine smile and make a friend in you. She would find you often and do her best to cheer you up by just being herself since she couldn't drag Baltimare to you. It was something to get used to, her personality, but she eventually grew on you and she had even begun to make you smile and then laugh at her best jokes and scoff at the ones that fell flat. At the darkest time, she had become the light of your days.


The memories make you feel better and you smile. You realize that you have been standing still outside Pinkie's door for a while. Her light is still on, but you don't hear movement. She must be in bed already and waiting for you, if she's not already asleep, after all, she was wearing her pajamas to begin with. The light blinds you when you open the door, your eyes slowly readjusting. You shield them with a hand as you blink a few times as you move into Pinkie's room. Finally able to keep them open, you open your eyes and your eyes fall across Pinkie's bed, the covers undisturbed.


"Huh, Pinkie?" you breathe in confusion. Looking left, looking right, you are about to sweep around when *click* the lights go out. Back in the darkness, the assault of light in your eyes leaves you blind. "Hey, what's going on? What'd you do that for?"


It must've been Pinkie at the light switch pulling another fast one on you, about to jump at you with a creepy mask on. You try to move, but immediately step on something unseen in the dark and lose your balance, arms flailing about. Suddenly, you feel gentle fingers press into your chest, steadying you. You have no time to thank the pony who can be none other than Pinkie, but gentle fingers become a firm shove with a palm that pushes you back. Only able to sputter a few confused syllables, all you can do is walk back to avoid falling over before the back of your knees hit a soft edge. The hand leaves your chest and you nearly regain balance when a finger flicks your nose.


"Boop!" says Pinkie.


You yelp, thinking you'll hit the floor, but you fall back into the soft bed instead. The bed shakes as Pinkie fallows you down, arms on with side of your head, her legs nearly straddling your hips, and then her muzzle presses gently to your nose again.


You gulp. It was obvious that Pinkie's playfulness around you had become somewhat sensual of late, but it had often been in jest of other relationships, making fun of that part of growing up. At the worst it was just Pinkie teasing you crazy for kicks. You didn't think Pinkie Pie ever wanted to take it seriously. To tell the truth, you didn't think she was ready, and neither did you think you were ready to go through with it, especially not like this, not here.


Pinkie's thighs tighten around you and her arms wrap around your shoulders as she presses her body into yours. You groan, arching your back so that she won't feel the stiffness building in your pants. You know you should stop this, but if she makes the first move, it will be difficult not to reciprocate. You don't know if you have enough willpower to resist.
123122111.title: Help Me With My Mind

1231221111.content:
"Uuuhh...*gulps* Pinkie?" you say nervously.

"Yes, (*Name*)?" she says back, playfully.

"What do you think you're doing?"

She smiles when you ask.

"Just snuggling my bestest buddy at my sleepover." she says with a chuckle
"Why do you ask?"

"Because you're REALLY close to me"

"Of course we're close! We've known eachother since you moved in with Twilight."
she says in response

"No, not close like friendwise. I mean you're really close to me."

"I don't get it." she says cluelessly.

You weren't sure if she was only messing around or if she really didn't know what it was you were saying.

"What I mean is-"

"Shhh!"

Suddenly, Pinkie covers your mouth with her hoof. She also has a very serious look on her face, which was rare for her.

"What is it?" you whisper as she loosens her grip

"Listen...." You hear footsteps out in the hallway. Must be Mr.(or Mrs.)Cake. You think.

They must have heard you guys come in a moment ago.
1231221111.title: Shhhh...

12312211112.content:
You and Pinkie hold in a collective breath as you watch the door with great intensity. You try your best to sit up to see across the bed to the furthest side of the room, but Pinkie is still unwittingly holding you down with her weight while looking over her shoulder, watching the door as well. You can feel her whole body stiffen through her palms her held to your shoulders when she sees the light in the hall click on and seep into the room from under the door.


"Pinkie!" you whisper urgently, "let me up!"


You could definitely push her off if you wanted to, but you didn't want to be so forceful with your friend, not to mention the noise it could cause, and those hoofsteps were drawing ever closer. In seconds they would be at the door! And Pinkie didn't even hear you!


"Pinkie!" you poke her sides to grab her attention.


"Oh! Uh...what?" she asks as if oblivious to the situation at hand (or hoof in her case).


"Get off'a me!" you demand, "I gotta hide!" It's when you're finally jerking your way out from under her that she gets up.


"But I was just thinking of a place for you to hide, since you really are bad at hide and seek. I know where--"


"Pinkie!"


Just then the hoofsteps stop just outside her door. Shit, maybe they would've just passed by; did they hear your talking? Too late to do anything now, the doorknob clicks as its mechanism turns and light spills into the dark room. Mr. Cake is standing there with Mrs. Cake right behind him. He is the first to see into the room, his eyes focusing in on whats happening on the bed.


"Pinkie?" he asks, "what's going on in here?"


"Oh, well, exactly what it looks like!"


"And what is it that I'm looking at?" he asks sternly.


"Just camping out on the bed and telling scary stories!" Pinkie Pie replies, turning the flashlight held in her hands onto her grinning muzzle. She was now under the sheets and had them propped up with a stick like a makeshift tent. "—with. . .uh. . .Gummy," Pinkie ad libs away, yet the little reptile helpfully pops his head up from underneath the covers, "and. . .umm. . .ooh, Mr Pillow!"


Ha! No matter how farfetched Pinkie's fibs will be, the Cakes will never be able to find you! Even as the light in Pinkie's room turns on, Mr. Cake clearly not swayed by her impression of your voice that she gave, er, Mr. Pillow. You hear his hoofsteps slowly circling the room, perhaps nonchalantly looking around for any. . .unwanted guests while you hear Mrs. Cake begin speaking to Pinkie about why she really shouldn't stay up late. There really wasn't much place to hide in Pinkie's room other than the closet, under the bed, and in the hooflocker, and a protective guardian like Mr. Cake would be sure to check the obvious places.


You on the other hand are not even in the room at all! Hanging by the tips of your fingers, you are holding yourself up just below Pinkie Pie's outside window sill. Okay, that sounds dangerous, but the second story roof is only a few feet below, so you are safe enough and can make your sneaky getaway if you need to, though you'd rather stay until the Cakes leave the room, because where else to go when it's this late? Your arms can probably hold out anyway. Best of all, you've completely dodged a bullet because Mr Cake won't check out the window because it's right behind Pinkie's bed. Genius. You are a freaking genius! If both your hands weren't occupied you would give yourself a pat on the b—


"Ooh Pinkie," you hear Mrs. Cake's voice, "it's pretty darn cold outside, would you be a dear and close your window?"


"Okie-dokie-lokie!"


You freeze.


In the next split second it takes for Pinkie to reach up and slam the window down onto your fingers you don't have much time to think about the things that could have been going through your head, and your next almost instinctual reaction of yanking your fingertips out of harm's way probably wasn't priority one because that's exactly what you did. A good question to ask yourself would be "dammit, Pinkie, why?" but the next moments as you fall and catch a glimpse of her face with a rather blank expression of "oops" etched all over it answer that one plainly enough.


Into the the darkness you fall a bit too perplexed to even cry out in surprise. You can feel yourself pitch as you fall, landing flush on your back with the angled roof, knocking the wind out of you. Too dazed to do anything, your body's inertia still forces you to slide and roll further down. You topple over the edge, but you regain control in time to throw your arms to the shingles and scrabble desperately for a firm grip.
12312211112.title: I Get Knocked Down. . .

123122111122.content:
Although you were able to grab the edge of the shingles on the roof, you were still too dazed to hold on effectively. That plus getting the wind knocked out of you meant you had almost no chance to begin with.

You fall off of the roof with a loud thud, as well as hitting your head on the ground with some amount of force, causing you to nearly blackout.

You remember looking up at the stars... how peaceful they looked, and how they were beginning to spin rapidly.

You then hear what sounds like a worried voice and something begins to move you.

You cared very little at this point.... you just wanted to sleep so much...

You drift off into unconciousness then and there.

-----------------------------------------------------------

You look around and see that you are walking back to Twilight's house. Wondering if she knew who Fluttershy was taking. You walk through the front door.

"I'm Home" you say softly, in case Spike or Twilight were asleep ready.

You flip on the lightswitch and see that things had been flipped over and some things were broken.

"Twilight!" you yell in worry for your friend, hoping she was alright.

Instead, you find her lying on the floor, clutching the book labeled "Elements of Harmony" she laid there in a pool of blood.

"No!!!" you yell as you run to her side and held her to your chest. "This can't be happening! Twilight!" you continue to call, in hopes of perhaps waking her.

"Please, Celestia! Don't let this happen! Twilight! Wake up!"

You start to see a shadow growing over you and Twilight as you cry her name.
You turn to see the project that you had abandoned in the cellar, now sitting in the middle of the room, still with the canvas cover laying over it.

You gently lay Twilight down and stand up. You turn, now facing the old creation, and reach for the cover.

You hand trembles as you do so and almost retreats at the touch. You pull the canvas off...

-----------------------------------------------------

Suddenly, you wake up in someone's bed. You look out of a nearby window and realize it is now morning. You feel a sudden rush of pain and pressure run to your head because you had sat up too quickly after what could only be described as a horrible nightmare.

"Where am I?" You ask yourself. "Looks like..."
123122111122.title: Still falling!

choices: You ask Fluttershy about who she's going with to the festival.
You get a text from Twilight.
1231221111222.content:
You look around a bit more and realize that you were in Fluttershy's cottage. Not only that, you were in her bed!

"What happened last night?" you ask yourself quietly

You continue to look around and sit up on the edge of the bed. As you do, you notice a familiar white rabbit.

"Oh, hey Angel Bunny." you say "Did Fluttershy bring me here?"

He nods his head and continues to gesture out what had happened roughly, you seem to be able to understand him though, about how you had fallen, hit yoir head and how fluttershy had seen you and helped you here.

"Where is Fluttershy now?" you ask, he simply points towards where the kitchen would be and hops off to do Celestia knows what. You scratch your head as you try to take a guess as to what, but quickly give up when you feel a bandage wrapped around your head.

Must have bumped myself pretty good. Or rather Pinkie did. Why did she have to do that?!

"(Name)? Are you feeling okay?" asked a shy Pegasus.

"Hey, Fluttershy, did you bring me back here?"

"Y-yes. I got the text you sent last night, about how you and Twilight needed help... But I didn't get it until a bit later... I was asleep when you sent it, but I got up for a drink of water... and when I got back I saw the text so-"

"So you came to see if you could help, right?" you say

"Yes... When I was at Twilight's, I saw a bubble of some kind around her house and I couldn't get in. Then I heard a loud noise and I went to see what it was, in case it was you or Twilight..." She looks at you very worriedly and drops her voice to a barely audible whisper. "i saw you on the ground.... you weren't moving, but you were still breathing..." Fluttershy was on the brink of tears. "If I had arrived sooner... when you sent the text, this might not have happ-"

You cut her off mid-sentence with a hug.

"Thank you, Fluttershy." you say calmly "I'm alright thanks to you. No need to worry, alright?"

She thinks about it for a moment. "...o-okay"

You release her from your hug and see that she has calmed down a bit.

"Would you like some breakfast?" she asks

"That would be awesome, Fluttershy." you say with a smile.

During breakfast...
1231221111222.title: A cottage on the edge of Everfree.

12312211112221.content:
You and Fluttershy had been eating peacefully as you helped yourselves to the nice breakfast that she had prepared for the two of you. It was a simple breakfast plate with scrambled eggs and black beans topped with tomatoes, avocado slices, and a snip of parsley. You also have a plate with toast and butter, and for drinks a glass of milk and another with orange juice. As you are just finishing up, picking at the last bits of food straying on your plate, your mind begins to wander back to the upcoming festival. It had taken a backseat to everything for the past few hours, but now that thing would (hopefully) revert back to normal, you were back to wondering who it was that Fluttershy was taking, and for that matter, who you would take. Twilight had said that she and Fluttershy had dates, yet they would have been the first one you would have wanted to ask to such an event.


"[Your Name], is something wrong?" Fluttershy asks.


"Hm? Oh," you realize that you had been staring blankly at your empty plate for a while now, "nothing, just have a little something on my mind."


Fluttershy's gaze lowers nervously as her hands fidget under the table. "Was it about what happened at the library?"


"You'd think so, but nah," you say lightheartedly. "Maybe the years in Baltimare made me accustomed vandalism, or something. No, I was thinking about that festival--what was it called, Tartarus and Elysium?--I still don't know who I should take."


"Oh, really?" Fluttershy perks up as the subject changes to something more pleasant. "Have you asked any of our other friends?"


"Hadn’t had much time, really."


"They've all been pretty busy themselves, so maybe they haven't had time to ask anyone yet," she suggested trying to be helpful in her friendly way. "I'm quite positive that Rainbow Dash is not going with anyone yet and I know that she is interested in attending. I could help you in asking her . . . that is, if you want."


You wanted to ease into this question so it wouldn't seem like you were prying: "Maybe I will. I would usually go with Twilight, but it looks like a date has asked her out already." You give her a curious smile, "Twilight also told me that someone asked you out as well."


"Well, sort of. He didn't ask me to the festival as much as I arranged to accompany him to the festival," she began as her cheeks began to blush. "You see, he's never really been to Ponyville or any town for that matter, living mostly all by himself. When we met, we started to talk about where both of us lived and when he said that he wanted to see the world, and I thought that the festival would be as good a chance as any for him. So, I proposed to be his escort into Ponyville."


"So what’s his name?” you ask the important question.


“His name is Hunter, and he’s a—”


“Just to clarify,” you back up, “he has not been in town, does not get out much . . . is this an old hermit living in the middle of the woods?”


“Well, no, he’s not old, but he does live in the Everfree Forest.”


“Okay, that makes se—what?” you reel. “The Everfree?”


“Yes,” Fluttershy affirms with jubilation, “and he practically knows all the woods around Ponyville like the back of his hoof. We met one day when I was escorting some animals to some new homes and he’s been kind enough to offer his accompany whenever I’m out there ever since.”


The thought of Fluttershy meeting someone in the Everfree and then leading them into town makes you dubious. However, you don’t want to assume too much, remembering the overreaction that Zecora’s presence had stirred a while ago. Still, you need to press the issue further and find out more about this Hunter, as he was called. The words built up on your tongue just as your phone went off, signaling a phone call. You grumble in annoyance, but ask politely for Fluttershy to excuse you, to which she smiles kindly and lets you go off to the adjacent room.

Who would be calling this early?
12312211112221.title: Got a Name, That's a Start

123122111122212.content:
"Hello?" you ask as you answer your cell phone.

"Hello, (*Name*)." Says Celestia with a very serious tone in her voice

"Twilight told me what had happened last night. Are you alright?"

"I'm fine, auntie, I'm fine. But whoever broke in last night was definitely after the elements of harmony." you reply, pacing in the kitchen.

"Are you absolutely sure?" She asks

"Twilight had put a charm on the elements in-case anyone were to try and steal them.
I am positive that someone was after them, auntie." you say

For a few moments there is is silence over the phone.

"Auntie Celeste?" you say, hoping that the call didn't drop.

"Alright, (*Name*). We have to assume that whoever did this is still after the elements.
I need you and the others to do something very important for me."

"Anything." you say

"We don't know who it is we are dealing with, do we?" she asks

"So far, no clue."

"Then I will need you to find out who it is that is after them. Anyone that is willing to steal the elements may also know how to exploit them, they cannot be allowed to escape and try to again. Therefore I will not be able to send anyone to look for them, it will draw too much attention. I'll need you and the others to do so for me."

You think for a moment about the severity of the situation... Just another day of saving Ponyville.

"I realize that I am putting allot on you at once, (*Name*)..." She says "But you and the others are the only ones that can help right now."

Another moment of silence passes

"I'll let you think about it for now. Please inform the others." she says

"Yeah... I will. Bye, auntie" you say as you hang-up.

You look over to see Fluttershy bringing in the dishes from breakfast and putting them in the sink.

"Is everything alright?" she asks

"Yeah, that was Auntie Celeste" you say still thinking about what she had asked of you

"The princess?" she responds with a somewhat worried sounding voice "What did she need?"

"We need to get a hold of the others, I'll send a message to them to meet us here."

"o-okay"

You type the message into your phone and send the mass text for everyone to meet you at Fluttershy's cottage, and that it was important.
123122111122212.title: Your auntie, the Princess.

1231221111222121.content:
It shouldn't take long for everyone to arrive now that you made them all eager to hear the news from Princess Celestia. You and Fluttershy sit idly, sipping away at your beverages while you explain to her that the responsibility for the protecting the Elements of Harmony and possibly Equestria itself has fallen squarely on the shoulders of you, her, and your friends all for the sake of discretion. Fluttershy becomes worried immediately:

"But how can we help?" She stammers. You give her a quizzical look that makes her cast her gaze down in thought. "Well, what I meant was, wouldn't it be safer if we let the the Guard take care of everything?"

You shrug. "I think Celestia is trying to bait the culprit into trying to steal the Element's again, you see, we really don't know what we're dealing with; whoever did it was very sloppy but very clean at the same time. Last night when Twilight was--"

There's a knock at the door. That's good, you won't have to repeat yourself again now that your friends are starting to arrive. You walk over to open the door and immediately a blur of blue zooms overhead into the house. Your eyes follow Rainbow Dash as she loops inside for back-flip and crouches into a perfect landing on both hooves, startling Fluttershy with her loud entry. Her pose grants you a few milliseconds to admire those beautifully athletic legs, that gorgeously toned posterior clad in tight black-and-white training shorts albeit slightly obscured by her rainbow tail, and her lithe body hugged by a grey workout shirt. Rainbow stands and turns around to smile at you, and you mentally slap yourself, thankfully able to look at her face and smile back.

"The gang's all here [Your Name]," she says

"Now hold on a moment, RD," calls Applejack's Dixie drawl right before she trots in. "Don't get [Your Name] to tell ya the big news before everyone has time to catch up." You move your head to see past Applejack and spot Rarity and Twilight far behind, just moseying along, seemingly in conversation. "I already had ta haul it on over here to catch up with ya'll without ya flyin' ahead. I'd say I made time good enough to beat yer ground speed records."

Rainbow just scoffs. "In your dreams, AJ." She then walks away to take a seat by Fluttershy.

"Mornin' there, [Your Name]," Applejack takes notice of you.

"Hi, Applejack," you reply.

"Say, what's that there dressin' ya have on yer head for?" She also takes notice in the bandage wrapped around your head.

"Oh what, this? It's nothing, just a headband." You only jest to make light of the fact, because Applejack can sniff out your lies. She however crosses her arms, expecting a better answer:

"I know a bandage when I see one. Did ya get that just yesterday?"

"Applejack really, it's no big deal, and I don't want to talk about--"

Her eyes narrow. "Did that feller Dumbbell take a swing at ya again?"

You grumble in irritation. "Fluttershy is this really necessary?" you turn to ask even as you are pulling the bandage off.

"Your head was bleeding [Your Name]. You really shouldn't take it off so soon."

Once it is off you feel the back of your head and feel the beginnings of a nasty scab forming under your hair. "It's just a scratch," you inform her, a little exasperated, but you smile so she knows you're just fine. You then look at Applejack and say, "See? Nothing."

"So, what happened?" Applejack asks, just curious now that she deduced that it wasn't a bully, but she still seems insistent.

"I just slipped and fell, because of...," you say, the ending kind of petering off into mumbles. Applejack blinks for a moment when you drop the reason, but shrugs and decides not to prod further.

"Okay then, just be more careful next time, alright partner?" She says, smacking your shoulder.

"Can do."

"Ooh, what a nasty cut on the back of your nut," comes a deliberate rhyme spoken right into your ear. Speak of Discord... "If I ever find that *mumble grumble mumble* that did this to your cute little head," Pinkie Pie glomps you around the neck, "it's in a world of trouble!"

All throughout your teeth are grinding away in anger. "Pinkie, a word," you tell her, pulling both of you outside and closing the door,

"Ooh, are we playing charades?" Pinkie lets go and bounces. "How many syllables? Make it a big one!"

"This is your fault!" you growl.

"Pfftth, that's four words, silly."

"The head wound, Pinkie! You dropped me out of the window!"

Pinkie gasps, "Wha?! I didn't drop you! ...I just closed the window on your fingertips." Pinkie smiles nervously and cringes at the last part. "Sorry, my bad. Although," she perks up again, "you really need to work on your hide-and-seek skills. You pick really bad spots."

"Grrr! Why'd you drag me in there if the Cakes were gonna freak out about it!?"

"Hey, I'd say you freaked out more than they did when you jumped out the window."

"And then what?! You just left me out there in the cold?!"

"No, I saw Fluttershy helping you, and I know how good she is with taking care of strange creatures."

"Hey!" you bawl indignantly, so frustrated at trying to contend with Pinkie's bubbly attitude that you feel as if a blood vessel could pop in your neck at any moment. "I had a nasty dream because of you!" you obviously ran out of arguments.

"Oh really? What about?" Pinkie gets eye to eye with you in her curiosity. You have to gently push her back as you know that no good can come from talking to her about these things.

"If I tell you what the dream was, you're not gonna go breaking out the tarot cards, are you?"

Pinkie averts her eyes in thought, then looks at you and says ".......Mmmmmmaaayyybe."

"Forget it," you let her go and heave a sigh, rubbing your temple. "Oh Celestia. I should have walked out when I had the chance."

"And not get the chance to sleepover at my place?" Pinkie asks.

"Not if it means breaking the house rules."

"Hey guys," calls Twilight, she and Rarity finally making it over to you two. "What were you two talking about?"

"Hi Twilight, hey Rarity," Pinkie greets the both of them, "[Your Name] and I were talking about last night when mmphmbfffbm--"

You cupped your hand over Pinkie's muzzle before she got any further. "Just a random Pinkie moment that I hope never has a bearing on my life...or even this next week for that matter."

Twilight raises her eyebrows. "Oh uh okay."

"[Your name]," speaks Rarity, "I don't mean to be rude but I have quite the order that I must fill by day's end. Could we possible get things going so I can get back to my work?"

"Yeah, okay. Everyone else is already inside."
1231221111222121.title: Blame

choices: Skip ahead to the dance festival...
12312211112221212.content:
As soon as everybody is inside and sits down, you tell them what Princess Celestia asked of yoi qnd the others.

"-and now she needs us to find out who is trying to steal the elements." you say

"Why doesn't she have the castle guard look into it or something?" asks Rainbowdash

"Because she doesn't want to draw any unnescesary attention to the issue. If she starts sending the colts in shining armor, we might just be scaring off the thief." you explain

"If he's runnin' scared, wouldn' that fix the problem?" asks AJ

"If he runs off, we won't know who this pony is or if they'll come back for the elements when things cool down." replies an almost anxious Twilight. "No, we need to find this thief. We don't know what he's capable of if they're after the Elements of Harmony. It could put the whole kingdom in danger..."

"Well, what should we do?" asks Rarity

"We need to bait the culprit..." you say

"With the Elements of Harmony." Twilight continues "We're gonna bring him to us. And I know just how to do it."

Everyone listens intently to what Twilight proposes.

"We'll lure him out during the Tartarus/Elysium dance festival by brining our elements to the event. There would be more than enough ponies there to hide out among the crowds, mostly on the first day, Tartarus. With all of the mosh-pits and loud music, it would be perfect conditions for a thief's getaway." You listen more and are actually impressed by how well thought out her plan was...

"The second day, in the Meadows, will probably be the least likely day that they would try to take them but enough is going on that they may still try." she continues

"What about the third day, Elysium?" asks Pinkie

"That's our last resort... If the thief doesn't make a move on the first or second days of the event we'll wear our Elements to the event in formal dress. This would be the most dangerous scenario to us becuase we wouldn't have them guarded in one place. We would possibly be facing the thief head on. But becuase they wouldn't be guarded so closely and becuase they'd be out in the open, the thief may just be desperate enough to try."

Everypony thinks it over for a moment. Even you.

It was a good plan amd definitely better than what you could have come up with in such a short amount of time. But if it does end up happening on Elysium it could put any one of your friends in mlrtal danger...

"I'm in." says Rainbowdash

"You can count me in too" says AJ

"And myself as well" says Rarity

"Me too! Me too!" says an entheusuastic Pinkie

"I'll go too..." you hear from Fluttershy

"It's settled then." Twilight looks at you, since you haven't said much of anything.

"[Your Name]?"

"Yeah?"

"Are you okay?" she asks

"It's a good plan, but... It's really dangerous if it goes bad-"

"You don't need to get involved if you don-" says Twilight

"Which is why I'm coming too." you say you continue

"Wait, what?" she asks

"I'm not going to let any of you get hurt, so I'm going too."

"Thank you,[Your Name]" she says with a smile and a hug. She soon lets you go and says "Alright everypony, and [Your Name], the dance isn't until next week. We still have lots to do before then. We'll see you there."

What happens now?
12312211112221212.title: Twilight already has a plan.

choices: "The night would be perfect if you went with me."
"Are you... taking anyone to the dance?"
13.content:
You decide to help Rarity. Out of all your pony friends, she was the pony you were closest to due to your common interest in art; she liked to design dresses, and you liked to draw cartoons. Sure, your distinct interests differed from hers, but you two still had a connection as fellow artists. Sure, your decision to help Rarity over the others was rather biased, but you can't help it. Besides, she can be a nervous wreck when it comes to determining whether a dress is good or not.


You text Rarity back saying that you'll be on your way in a few minutes. You then text the others, saying that you won't be able to help them. It takes you ten minutes to walk to the Carousel Boutique. You knock on the door and hear some hoofsteps rushing to answer it. You smile at the mare that greets you.


"[Your name], darling!" she says with delight, giving you a hug. "I'm so glad you're here!"


"I was told you needed my 'artistic opinion' on some designs of yours," you say.


"You heard right," she says. She then proceeds to show you several designs that she came up with, and when she's finished, she looks at you with a hopeful look in her eyes.


"I think they're all really good, Rarity," you say, giving your honest opinion.


The white unicorn sighs in disappointment. "'Really good' just isn't going to cut it this time, [your name]," she says.


"Why?" you ask.


Rarity sighs again. "You know the school year is almost over, right?"


"Yeah..." you say, not knowing where she's going with this.


"Well, what event comes up every year at the end of the school year?" she asks.


You honestly didn't know the answer to that.


"The end-of-school dance, silly!" Rarity says.


"Oh, so I guess you want this night to be perfect, huh?" you say.


"Yes," she says, looking away from you.


What does she say next?
13.title: Second Opinion

131.content:
"There is something silly I wish to tell you", she says.

"Ok, what would that be?"

"Would you like to go to the dance with me? This..." She smiles for a second. "I believe that this might would be quite exciting for the both of us."

You looked at her, she looked a bit nervous while looking at you as she was hoping you would say yes.

She caught your eyes and then smiled even more brightly at you.

Rarity was a really hot looking girl and secretly you though to yourself, why the hell not.

"Very well then", you mumbled to yourself.

"I am sorry, but..." She started to say but you didn't give her a chance to say anything because you quickly stepped really close to her and then kissed her.

1331121122122112.title: ITS ANOTHER TRAP!!!!!

choices: ...she brought Bon Bon with her to apologize.
13311211221221122.content:
After waking up with a start, you look around and see that you're home in your room. You sit up, then feel something slide down your face and land in your lap.


"An ice pack?" you say. You're sure that you'd be in the hospital after the ass kicking you just got. You don't know who was helping Bon Bon, but you had a good feeling that some of them were your usual tormentors that probably wanted to make a quick buck. You look outside your window and see that the sun is setting. You've been out for quite some time, it seems. Normally, you'd be pissed that you now had to do your homework during the time where you usually relax, but since it was the second-to-last week of school, the only "homework" you've missed out on was studying for finals.


The door to your room opens, and Twilight walks in. Her eyes widen when she sees that you're awake, and she rushes to your side. "You're awake! Thank goodness!" she says.


"What am I doing here?" you ask. "After what happened, I should be in the hospital."


"I used healing magic to fix you up," Twilight explains. "Nothing was broken, so it wasn't anything I couldn't handle. As long as you don't do anything too strenuous, you'll be as good as new by tomorrow morning."


"Thanks," you say. Twilight smiles at you, but then her expression turns sour. "I told you that looking for Bon Bon was a bad idea!" she says sternly. "If you'd just listen to me for once, you wouldn't be in half the trouble you're in now! Do you have any idea how scared I was for you!?" The unicorn tried to sound angry, but she sounded more like she was on the verge of crying.


You sigh, and look to the ground for a second. "Does Celeste know about this?" you ask.


"I haven't told her yet," Twilight answers.


"Don't tell her," you say. "Knowing her, if she finds out, her reaction will be worse than yours."


"So you're just going to keep putting up with Bon Bon tormenting you?" she asks, getting agitated again. "I have half a mind to not let you go to school tomorrow!"


"You don't have to be so strict with me," you say.


"You are such a freaking idiot!" Twilight says loudly. "Don't you think the reason why I'm like that is because I don't want you getting hurt? Do you have any idea how much it hurts me to see you suffer so much, not to mention the fact that this is all over Lyra! Why do you care about her so much, now? Up until recently, you two barely even spoke to each other, and now you're risking your life for her!"


You stay silent for a second, then you say "I guess I'm just too nice."


Twilight opens he mouth to speak yell at you, when suddenly there's a knock on your door. "[Your name]!" Spike calls from the other side. "Somepony's here to see you!"


The door opens, and Lyra walks in, and you see that...
13311211221221122.title: Speedy Recovery

133112112212211221.content:
Her shocked expression tells you that she didn't believe what happened. At first she thought that Bon Bon was lying, but now she knows the truth.

Nonetheless, Twilight still kept her angered expression, showing more of it than what she did to you. "What do you want, Lyra?"

Lyra was slightly hurt, but she replied either way. "I wanted to check up on [your name]. I heard about what happened and--"

"Yeah, well, he's fine now, no thanks to Bon Bon. It's gonna be sooner or later I arrange a restraining order!"

"Twilight..." you start, "calm down."

"Matter of fact, you're even lucky he still puts up with all of this. Even though he could've died just a few hours ago trying to make his story heard, he is just too persistent!"

"I wasn't asking for his help! I just wanted to take him to the dance."

"Sure, just days later after you broke up with Bon Bon!?"

"Why are you acting so hostile to me, Twilight!?" Lyra exclaims, now pissed and scaring you since you know that this will get ugly soon.

"Why else!?--"
133112112212211221.title: ... and has to deal with Twilight.

choices: "Fine, but only for you..." (Come out of hiding.)
"Screw what he has to say!" (Time for the alternative!)
1331121122122112211.content:
"This was all YOUR fault!" Twilight says with an accusing finger.


"My fault!?" Lyra says defensively. "I didn't ask Bon Bon to treat [your name] like this! I'm just as mad at her as you are!"


"Why don't you work out your problems with her instead of dumping them on [your name]!" Twilight yells.


"I didn't ask him to do all this for me! I just wanted to go to the dance with him!" Lyra retorts.


"You didn't do this, you didn't do that; it's just everypony's fault but your own, isn't it?" Twilight asks rhetorically.


"Twi, stop it. Pointing fingers isn't going to help anyone," you say. "We just need to-"


"You just need to stop risking yourself for Lyra!" the unicorn snaps.


"What are you, his mom?" Lyra asks.


"Someone has to be, 'cause this is the type of shit that happens when he doesn't think!" Twilight argues. Now you know she's angry. Twilight NEVER curses unless she's very upset. "Just go, Lyra. You've caused enough trouble as it is. Just tell your psycho ex-girlfriend to stay away from [your name], and if she doesn't, I'll deal with her personally!"


"That's enough, Twilight!" you yell, causing both mares to flinch in surprise. "I chose to get involved in this, and I'm gonna get out of this mess. If you really want what's best for me, you'll help me and Lyra work this all out with Bon Bon."


Twilight opens her mouth to say something, but she sighs and decides not to. "Fine," she says.


Lyra sighs in relief. "Okay, so what are we gonna do?"


You think for a minute. "Alright, here's what we're gonna do..."


Later that night...


Lyra waits at the Ponyville park, the moon illuminating the night sky. Earlier she had called Bon Bon and asked her to meet her there, according to plan. She looks around and sees Bon Bon approaching her. The plan was simple: convince Bon Bon to talk to you calmly. If it was a success, you'd come out of your nearby hiding spot and talk to her. If not, Twilight would immobilize her with a paralysis spell and force her to talk to you.


"Hi, Lyra!" she says with a smile. "You wanted to talk to me?"


"Yeah," the unicorn replies. "It's about [your name]."


The earth mare's demeanor turns sour instantly. "Ugh, you called me here to talk about him?"


"You're taking things too far," Lyra says. "You're lucky nopony important found out. You beat him up on school grounds! You could've been expelled, or worse, jailed!"


"I couldn't let him have you," Bon Bon says bluntly, as if her act was justified.


"It's this type of possessive attitude that made me want to break up with you in the first place!" the unicorn says. "What happened between us is just that, between us. What do you have against [your name]? He just wanted to talk to you."


"It's not just him. It's ANYone that tries to take you from me," Bon Bon says.


"I'm not some object you can own, Bon Bon!" Lyra yells. "Sometimes I ask myself if you ever really loved me..."


"What do you mean?" the earth pony says. "I do love you, Lyra. Why do you think I'm doing all this?"


"If you really love me, you'll let [your name] say what he has to say," says the unicorn.
1331121122122112211.title: Let's Play the Blame Game!

"... have a slight crush on... [your name]..." This leads Twilight to anger...

"Screw what he has to say!" Bon Bon says. "I can care less about it anyway! If he thinks he can take you away from me, he has another thing coming!"

It didn't take a signal for Twilight to use the paralysis spell already. While having Bon Bon levitated, she struggles to no avail.

"I guess the inference I made was wrong," Lyra says, nearly going into tears seeing that her answered question was a half-truth.

After "casually" walking walking out, you and Twilight make yourselves seen.

"I guess we really did need to use force to get these answers out of you, Bon Bon," you state.

"[Your name]!?"

"Who else but?"

"What do you want?"

"I just wanted for you to listen to my side of the story, for you to see that I wasn't the one making any advances, remarks, or insults whatsoever. On the contrary, it was Lyra who asked me to the dance."

"What!? Lyra, you--!?" You could've sworn you heard her quivering. "Why would you do something like that, Lyra!?"

"Bon Bon, I'm tired of you being possessive of me even when we broke up. And like you said, it's not just [your name] but anypony you see looking at me gets you pissed off. I asked him to the dance because..."

You never knew why, but you knew that Lyra had some other reason to take you.

"Why, Lyra..?"

"I..."
13311211221221122112.title: Her reasons why

133112112212211221122.content:
"I... have a slight crush on [your name]..." Lyra finally manages to say.


"WHAT!?" Bon Bon and Twilight yell, while you give and exasperated sigh. You were hoping to get Lyra and Bon Bon back together, but this just made things even more complicated.


"Why HIM!?" the earth pony asks.


"Because he's nice, and he's sensitive," the mint green unicorn explains. "Most of all, he's forgiving. Even when you ambushed him, he was still willing to talk to you. I don't think any person or pony would ever do that. Even when he first moved to Ponyville, and everypony at school either made fun of him or avoided him, he didn't hold a grudge, and now, almost everypony likes him. When I asked him out, I was afraid that he was going with somepony else, and I thought I was pretty lucky that he wasn't."


Twilight's mind flashes back to when she was considering asking you out the night before Lyra asked you, and she begins to see how big of a mistake that was. "Dammit!" she thought. "If I had just asked him that night, none of this would have happened. Stupid, stupid, stupid!"


Lyra then holds your hand, grasping it firmly and angering both Twilight and Bon Bon. You immediately try to alleviate this.


"Look, Lyra," you say. "I'm flattered that you feel this way about me. I really am, but... I don't think that I'm the right one for you. Bon Bon loves you more than I or any other person or pony could. Sure, she can get a little angry, but I think that with a little help, it's something that can be fixed. You'll be a lot happier with her once you straighten things out."


The unicorn looks at you, then lets go of your hand. All the while, Twilight does an inner dance of happiness, ecstatic at the opportunity for Lyra to come out of the picture. Lyra looks at her ex and says...

"I'm sorry Bon Bon but I've made up my mind"Lyra said

You started examine you environment, as you were under the bridge a hand came out of the darkness and pulled you in you felt some pony start to passionately kiss you you wanted to break free but you couldn't something was binding your limbs down so you cant break free it was to dark to see who it was but by what you could based it off on the was definitely female and how these bind felt it was absolutely unicorn magic you had known this because Twilight had held you down many times when you either tried to get the remote or the last doughnut.

The white light emitting from the unicorns horn reveals that Twilight is the mare that just kissed you.


"Twilight!?" you say in shock, coughing from lack of oxygen. She kissed you for a little too long.


"I'm sorry, [your name]," she says. "This is something I felt like I had to do before it was too late."


"Couldn't this have waited?" you ask, slightly irritated.


"No, it couldn't!" the unicorn asserted. "I don't want to lose you to Lyra!"


"Is that what this is all about?" you ask, exasperated. "You were just jealous of Lyra?" Twilight nods her head, finally admitting how envious she was. "There was nothing to be jealous about. I'm trying to get Lyra and Bon Bon back together, so I obviously don't have the feelings for her that you thought I did."


"Really?" she asks. "I'm sorry. I just didn't want to lose you to anypony. I've liked you for so long, and the dance was my chance to finally admit my feelings, and I didn't want to lose that chance."


The unicorn hugs you as tightly as she can, tears running down her face. You sigh softly and stroke her mane in an attempt to soothe her, and it seems to be working. The sniffling starts to subside, and her grip on you loosens a little. She looks at you with quivering eyes and you smile softly at her as you wipe the tears from her eyes.


"We'll work this out when we get home, but right now, I have to find Lyra, okay?" you say.


Twilight nods her head and says "Okay."


You walk out from under the bridge to continue your search for Lyra when...

You run to catch up to her and when you take the turn, you see that...
