"I know that I haven't been myself lately, [your name]. I guess you deserve an explanation as to why I've been so possessive of you lately," she says. "It's just that... after you told me about all your girl problems, I started to realize how much you've been growing up. It seems like just yesterday that you told me that girls were gross."


Celestia chuckles to herself and continues. "I told your parents that I would take care of you while you went to high school here in Ponyville, and I wanted to make sure that you'd always have someone to talk to, but lately, you seemed like you had more important things to do. You're starting to date girls now, and in just over a year you'll be heading off to college..."


At this point that Celestia's voice begins to crack.


"I... I just couldn't bear the thought of that, so I had this house built for the two of us to live in. I even brought all your old stuff to put in your room to remind you of your childhood."


"And that's why you set a strict curfew and said that I couldn't have any girls over..." you finish.


Celestia sniffles and nods her head. After letting a tear roll down her face, she wraps yo in a tight hug and starts to sob.


"I'm so sorry, sweetie!" she says. "I just couldn't imagine you not needing me anymore. I didn't mean to try and cut you off from your friends. It's just that I didn't want to lose you because... you're like the son I never had!"


You sat there, Celestia's arms still wrapped around you, taking in what she said. It pretty much explained everything she's been doing, which was all for good reason. You hug your aunt back just as tightly as she was hugging you.


"It's okay, Auntie Celeste," you tell her. "I'm not mad at you. I understand why you did what you did, but I'm seventeen years old now. Besides, I'm always gonna need you, so you don't have to worry about losing me."


Celestia starts to calm down, and she let's go of you, happy that you've forgiven her.


"I'll tell you what," you say. "I'll let you live here with me until the end of summer, but after that, you have to go back to Canterlot. You can't just leave Luna by herself forever."


"Alright, that sounds fair," says your aunt, and she hugs you once more.


You sigh in relief, having cleared all the air between you and Auntie Celeste. Just then, you get a phone call. Who is it?
1412121111111221112221112211122221.title: An Overdue Explanation

14121211111112211122211122111222211.content:
"Hello?"

"Hello, darling!" you hear from Rarity. "How are you doing today?"

Celeste takes this as time you need alone. She nods and leaves just before you resume talking to your filly friend.

"Okay, Rarity. What about you?"

"Oh, just working up on our last details for prom! You haven't forgotten, have you?"

Just momentarily during this moment. "Of course not, Rarity. I'm still looking forward to it. So, what are the details? You know how punctual I am."

"How can I forget, (your name). So, how about you pick me up at 6 on Friday? Since it starts at seven, we might as well just be the first ones there."

"Sure, Rarity. I can't wait for the prom."

"(Giggle) Well, I have to let you go here, darling. I still need to finish a few designs that were requested."

"Okay. Bye, Rarity."

"Good night, (your name)."

You hang up and sigh. Smiling about prom, it turns somewhat sad when you realized that you're not going with Applejack. You then think about what to do later on. It all may have been avoided if you haven't said anything to Applejack, but where would that leave you with Rarity?

You're thinking too hard. Right now, you have to finish dinner and see what to do for tomorrow, especially since its school.
14121211111112211122211122111222211.title: Last deets for prom

141212111111122111222111221112222111.content:
The next day, after agreeing to let Celestia share a bed with you for the night, you head off to school, ready to take on the day. With prom night only four days away, you're in a really excited mood. You meet Twilight in the main hall of the school, and start talking about prom.


"So, who's taking you to prom?" you ask.


"Why should I tell you who my date is if you won't tell me who your date is?" she asks back.


"Touché," you say, "unless you don't really have a date."


"I do so have a date!" says Twilight.


"Yeah right," you say nonchalantly.


"I do so! He's the colt that sits behind you in Chemistry class!" Twilight yells, only to cover her mouth after realizing that she just told you who her date was.


"Gotcha," you say, as you walk off to your first class, leaving Twilight fuming mad. You missed messing with her like that.


The day goes by smoothly, until you get to your last class of the day: math. You and Applejack sat next to each other in that class, and today, the teacher was asking all the students questions as a way to review for the upcoming test. When he finally gets to Applejack, you see her face freeze. She looks at you, as if she were pleading for help.


"Well, Miss Applejack?" says the teacher. "What does x equal in this equation?"


AJ sits there, totally confused and racking her brain. "Umm... ah... it's..."


As a last resort, you lightly tap AJ's hoof three times with your foot. Taking your hint she says "Three?"


"Correct, Miss Applejack," the teacher says. "Hopefully you can answer the questions on the test without any outside help." He says those last few words looking at you. Before another question was asked, the bell rings, and everypony stampedes out of the classroom, you and Applejack being the last to leave. "Don't forget to do your homework!" he says as everypony leaves.


The cowpony sighs in frustration. "Ah am mighty screwed when that test comes up, and it's this Thursday!" she says. She hangs her head down, thinking of the bad grade she'll get, but suddenly she looks up at you with hope in her eyes. "Say, tiger," she says. "Ya don't suppose that ah can stop by yer house an' you can help me with mah homework, do ya?"


You stand there for a second, mulling it over. While you did settle things with Celestia, you still aren't sure if she's completely okay with you having girls over. You'll just have to test it out today. "Sure," you tell AJ.


The two of you walk from school all the way to your house, and you open the door, telling Applejack to wait outside for a second. Inside, you see Celestia sitting on the couch, dressed in a normal t shirt and jeans. This was the first time you saw your aunt in such casual wear.


"Welcome home, [your name]," she says.


"Hey, Auntie Celeste," you say.


"How was school?" she asks.


"Good," you say nervously, "and I... brought a friend home with me..." You then open the door, letting Applejack in.


"Howdy, princess!" she says.


How does Celestia react to this?
141212111111122111222111221112222111.title: Homework Help

1412121111111221112221112211122221112.content:
"Err, good afternoon, Applejack," Celestia replies, "How are you today?"

"Ah'm mighty fine, princess. Albeit, little scared for an uocoming test, so Ah was hopin' to study wit' (your name). Ah'mma jus' set mah stuff down."

After Applejack leaves, now it was Celestia's turn to talk. You knew she would've taken it the wrong way.

"Auntie Celeste, look, I'm sorry I didn't ask you earlier if I could have a study partner, but you already know how it is."

"Relax, (your name), I'm not mad," Celestia replies. "Yes, I still may be at that jealousy point, and I may have gone a bit much when I said no girls over since all your friends are, but you know how I can get when..." She starts to get reminiscense about her explanation yesterday.

"Celeste, I told you, I--"

"No, it's fine, just... don't get too comfortable, okay?" Celestia brought up that scene in your mind about that night after the party with the cider.

"Don't worry, Auntie."

She smiles and lets you go. "Well, hurry up and study. You know how I feel about bad grades." You knew she tried to be a mother-figure, but the school thing is a little too far.

"Okay." You go upstairs and help Applejack out with your math. It was a chore, since she forgets most of the time, but it was worth it to spend time with her, that, and you admire her persistence on whether she will get things right. Right after you're done, you get a call on your cell phone.

Which pony was it?
1412121111111221112221112211122221112.title: Still not exactly through with that

14121211111112211122211122111222211122.content:
"Hello?"


"Hey, [your name]," says the pony on the other end. "What's up?"


"Nothing, Twilight," you say. "Just helping Applejack with her homework."


"I thought Princess Celestia said no girls allowed," says Twilight.


"I was able to convince her to let me have girls over," you say.


"Well, good for you," she says. "I told you that you didn't have to worry so much. Celestia is a reasonable pony."


"Yeah, yeah," you say.


"Looks like we'll be able to have a housewarming party after all," she says.


"I guess, but it's not that important," you say.


"Well, we can always discuss that after prom. Speaking of which, who are you taking?" she asks. "I told you who my date is, so return the favor."


"You told me who your date was by accident," you say. "So I don't have a favor to return."


"Come ooooooooooooooonnn!" the unicorn whines.


"Quit whining," you say. "You sound like Rarity. Waiting till prom night isn't gonna kill you."


Before Twilight answers, you hang up the phone. "So, AJ," you say. "Where were we?"


"We were done," the cowpony says.


"Oh, right," you say, and there's a moment of quiet. You then speak up. "Applejack, I'm sorry I'm making you and Rarity wait for me to decide who I like more."


"Aw, don't worry about it," she says, waving a hand. "Take all the time ya need. Yer worth waitin' for."


"Thanks," you say. "You know, there's two things that I'm scared of when it comes to this decision."


"Like what?" Applejack asks.


"Well, you might be mad at me if I choose Rarity, and Rarity might be mad at me if I choose you," you explain.


"Now y'all don't need ta worry about dat," she says. "If ya don't choose me, then ah'll hafta take advantage of the time ah have with ya."


Applejack pulls you into a tight bear hug. After she lets you go, she gives you a deep kiss on the lips, embracing you again, but much more softly. You begin to kiss her back,, but then you remember that Celestia was downstairs. By the time you realize this, Applejack is already on top of you. She let's go of the kiss and rests on top of you, nuzzling her head next to yours.


"AJ," you say.


"Yes, hon?" she says with a trance-like tone in her voice.


"Celestia's downstairs," you say, reminding her.


"Oh, right..." she says, getting off of you. "So, can ah come over on the day before the test?"


"Sure," you say, and Applejack goes on her merry way.
14121211111112211122211122111222211122.title: Twilight

141212111111122111222111221112222111221.content:
Two days later, you and Applejack meet up at the front entrance of Ponyville High once school ends. Once you find each other, you set off for your house.


"You were pretty impressive in class today, AJ," you tell her. "You answer Mr. Calc's question without breaking a sweat."


"Ah, know. Ah can't even believe it mahself," she says. "It's all thanks t' you, sugarcube."


"I can't take all the credit," you say modestly. "You were the one who was willing to keep trying."


"True," she says. "Well, Ah'm ready ta study mah flank of today! Ah'm gonna ace this test!"


"That's the attitude," you say, like a proud teacher. The two of you finally reach your house, and you walk in to see Celestia washing dishes.


"Hey, you two," she says, tuning to see you.


"Hi, Auntie Celeste," you say, and Applejack giggles. You try not to refer to Celestia as your aunt (ESPECIALLY in front of Twilight, knowing how jealous she gets), but you were talking to her in person, so if you referred to her by her real name, she'd then correct you and Applejack would've been giggling harder.


"You can go upstairs, Applejack," says Celestia. "I want to talk to [your name] for a minute."


AJ nods her head and goes upstairs to your room.


"So," says Celestia, "You're studying with Applejack for that big test tomorrow, huh?"


"Yeah," you say.


"I hope you don't end up making out with her afterwards like the last time she was here," she says somewhat sternly.


You freeze and look at her in shock. "How did you know that we made out?"


"I didn't," she said. "You just told me."


You blush with embarrassment. You walked right into that one.


"Seriously though," she says. "I know it's hard to control yourself, but try not to do that. I sleep in that bed, too."


"Yes, Auntie," you say, and you trudge up the stairs.


After studying with Applejack for a good two hours, she feels fully confident that she was going to ace that test.


"Yee-haw! Ah'm so ready!" she says. "Thanks a plenty, tiger. Ah couldn't have done it without ya."


"No problem, AJ," you say.


"Ya know..." she says, looking at you with a glint in her eyes. "Ah should reward ya fer all yer hard work."


"Haven't we kissed each other enough recently?" you ask.


"How else am ah supposed ta catch up with Rarity?" she asks back.


"Rarity and I have only kissed once," you say.


"Really? That's a surprise," says Applejack. "Even so, ah'm sure you two will be doin' a lot of kissin' on prom night."


"You seem to be pretty okay with me liking the both of you," you say.


"Well, ah can't deny that the idea of Rarity and I both bein' yer girlfriends has been growin' on me, but ah don't wanna let that affect yer decision," she says. "Well, ah oughta be gettin on home. See ya tomorrow, hon!"


"Bye," you say.


"Oh, an' by the way," she says. "Yer gonna git it fer not lettin me kiss ya today. Ah'm gonna pay you back with interest."


You awkwardly cross one leg over the other when you hear that.


Later that night, when you and Celestia go to bed, Celestia asks you something.


"Sweetie, what was Applejack talking about 'paying you back with interest'?" she asks.


"I don't know..." you say, turning away from her.


Celestia eyes you suspiciously, but decides to drop the issue.


The next day at school, you have math as your first class of the day, according to your rotating schedule. Applejack doesn't seem to mind. To her, the sooner this test is overwith, the better. After the test, you and AJ meet outside the classroom.


"That test was so easy!" says the cowpony. "Ah wonder if Mr. Calc will have it graded by the end of today."


"Well, he is pretty quick with grading tests, and the test was multiple choice, so there is a good chance that he will," you say. Your assumption proves to be correct, as Mr Calc was able to give everyone their tests back at the end of the day. Unfortunately, AJ's mood takes a turn for the worse.


"Ah can't believe it!" she says. "Ah got a 49! Ah was so sure I got an A."


You take a look at AJ's paper. "You did get an A, Applejack," you say.


"Last time ah checked, a 49 was an F," she says.


"Look again," you say. "You didn't get 49 percent, you got 49 out of 50 questions correct. That's 98 percent, AJ! You aced it!"


"Really!?" she says in disbelief. She pulls you into a tight bar hug, practically squeezing the breath out of you, then she lets you go. "Thanks a plenty, sugarcube!"


"Anytime," you say. Just then, you see Rarity approaching the two of you, and she looks...
141212111111122111222111221112222111221.title: Preparation

choices: Something might cause her to probably miss prom night.
You are hanging out more with Applejack than with her.
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content: Well, knowing Rarity, there are a few things making her feel melancholic. But why is that?
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: Depression comes from where?

1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
"What's wrong, Rarity?" you ask.


"Yeah, ya seem kinda down," says Applejack.


"Nothing," she says. "I just feel a little ignored, is all."


"Ignored?" you ask.


"Yes, ignored!" she says with a pout. "Why do you keep hanging out with Applejack?"


"I was helping her study for a test," you explain.


"Even so," says Rarity, "You haven't called me all week. I miss hearing your voice sometimes."


You know you should feel guilty, but the tone in which Rarity was talking was pretty cute.


"Aww..." you say. Walking up to her and hugging her. "Somepony's feeling a little lonely..."


"Don't patronize me," she says, turning her head away from you. She couldn't help but crack a smile, though. While other ponies found Rarity's whining pretty annoying, you always found it to be rather cute.



"Tell you what," you say. "Since tomorrow is prom night, and the next day is Saturday, I'm gonna spend that entire day with you, and we can do whatever you want."


The unicorn looks at you as if she were expecting more.


"And I promise to call you more often," you say.


"Fine, we have a deal." Rarity says, and she hugs you back.


"Feel better now that yer gettin' some attention?" AJ asks teasingly.


"Oh, you're horrible, Applejack!" says the unicorn with a giggle.


The following afternoon, at around quarter to six, you are shuffling around your closet for a tie. This was your first formal event in years, so you don't exactly keep track of ties. You only had fifteen minutes to be at the Carousel Boutique to pick up Rarity, and here you are looking for a stupid tie!


"Looking for something?" asks Celestia.


"Just searching for a tie, Auntie Celeste," you say.


"Well why didn't you say so?" she says. Her horn begins to glow, and a brand new tie appears out of thin air. "See, you had nothing to worry about."


"Thanks, Auntie," you say.


"No problem, sweetheart," she says. "So, the carriage I ordered for you just pulled up outside, so you can go whenever you're ready. Have fun!"


"I will," you say. You give Celestia a hug after she helps you with your tie, and you set off for Rarity's.


Meanwhile, at the Carousel Boutique, Rarity finishes getting ready for you to pick her up. She sprays some perfume in her mane and waits by her bedroom window for you to arrive. She sees a royal carriage pull up in front of the boutique, and she's confused at first, but then she realizes that you had gotten a carriage to ferry you to and from the prom. The unicorn giddily rushes down the stairs, reaching the door just in time for you to knock on it.


"[Your name], darling!" she says. "You're looking very handsome this evening."


"Thanks," you say, "and you're looking really beautiful."


"Oh, stop!" she says with a blush. "You're embarrassing me."


"Sorry about that," you say. "Well, your carriage awaits, princess."


Once you two get into the carriage, you start to chat with each other.


"So, [your name]," asks Rarity. "How many times have you kissed Applejack?"


To be honest, you lost count, so you just make up a number. "Four, why?" you ask.


"Because I plan on evening the score before the night's over," she says with a wink.
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: Feeling Neglected

choices: A slow song plays and a spotlight shines on you and Rarity.
Princess Luna makes a guest appearance.
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
Soon, you and Rarity finally make it to the dance. You're glad that Rarity wanted you to pick her up an hour before the prom started, because there were other ponies that had the idea of taking carriages to the prom. When you finally get inside, you see everypony dancing to the upbeat music.


"Wow, they even got DJ Pon-3 to show up," you say.


"Very impressive," says Rarity. "The planning committee has outdone themselves this time around."


All of a sudden, four ponies come rushing towards you and Rarity, startling the two of you. Then again, you should have expected Twilight, Rainbow Dash, Pinkie Pie, and Fluttershy.


"Wait, so you were taking RARITY to prom?!" says Twilight, with a look of shock on her face.


"I had no idea you two were together..." says Fluttershy.


"Ha! You owe me twenty bits, Rainbow!" says Pinkie.


"Luna-dammit..." Rainbow Dash says under her breath.


"Now, now, girls," says Rarity. "[Your name] only took me here as a favor to me. I din't have a date, and I didn't want to go alone, so I asked him to take me. We're only here as friends."


You let out an inner sigh of relief. This saves you the trouble of having to come up with an excuse yourself. Leave it to Rarity to think ahead. You and your "date" hit the dance floor and dance for a good hour and a half. You eventually get a little tired, and ask Rarity if she wants anything to drink.


"Why thank you, darling," she says. "Some punch would be nice."


You walk over to the refreshments table and ask for two cups of punch. When you get your drinks and walk over to where Rarity was waiting for you, you see Twilight dancing with the colt she had mentioned when you tricked her into telling who she was going. You chuckle to yourself at how badly Twilight is dancing. Her date didn't seem to mind, though.


You make it to where Rarity was waiting for you, and hand her a cup of punch. "Thank you ever so much, sweetie," she says. After shifting her eyes around to make sure nopony was watching she sneaks in a quick kiss on your lips. "That makes two kisses before I'm caught up with Applejack," she says, more to herself than to you. You decide to let her have her fun, since you weren't even sure how many times you've actually kissed AJ. After relaxing for a while, a song comes on that makes Rarity squeal.


"Oh my Celestia!" she says. "I LOVE this song!" The unicorn practically yanks you onto the dance floor and you both dance to the song. Once it ends, though, something happens that nopony at the dance was expecting, especially you and Rarity.
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: The Best Night Ever (Even Better Than the Gala)

choices: "Would you come up to my room, please?"
"Where would you like to go tomorrow?"
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
All of a sudden, the room brightens up. You had to squint your eyes because of how sudden it was. When you get yourself together, though, you see that it's not the whole room that was lit, but just the immediate area around you and Rarity. The music slows down, and while you could barely see the ponies that weren't in the spotlight, you could feel their gazes.


"This isn't... what I think it is, is it?" asks Rarity.


"I hope not," you say quietly. "I don't feel comfortable dancing with everypony watching us."


You look over at DJ Pon-3 and she lifts her shades and winks at you, as if she had planned for this to happen. How could she know that you and Rarity were here together? Does she have some kind of sixth sense? Nah, this was all by chance. You're over thinking things.


"Well don't just stand there!" yells somepony in the crowd. You could tell that it was Rainbow Dash.


"I'll just have to suck it up," you think. You take Rarity's hands and dance with her to the slow music that was playing. You soon began to disregard the ponies that were watching you, and dance with your date as if the entire gymnasium was empty save for you two. When the song finally ends, everypony claps their hands, cheers, and stomps their hooves. You shyly stand there with Rarity, taking in all the praise.


After that little slow dance, you and Rarity find a seat on the bleachers to the side of the gymnasium. Rarity's been pretty quiet for the past few minutes, and it starts to worry you.


"You okay, Rarity?" you ask.


"Oh, don't worry about me, darling," she says, her voice breaking. "I'm just fine."


The unicorn looks up at you. Tears are running down her face, but she has a smile on her face. "This is the best night I've ever had," she says. "I'm so glad you could take me here, [your name]." She then wraps you in a warm hug, burying her head in her shoulder. "Do you mind if we leave early, sweetie?" she asks.


"We've only been here an hour," you say.


"It's eleven fifteen," she says. "We're only leaving forty five minutes early."


You look at your watch and realize how much time has flown by. "All right then, let's go."


When you finally reach the Carousel Boutique, you tell the carriage drivers that they can go home, since you intend on walking home. They happily oblige and leave you and Rarity alone on her doorstep. Once you head inside, you give a sigh of relief.


"Why the sigh?" asks Rarity.


"I'm just relieved that nothing went wrong," you say. "All that's left is to say goodnight,"


You walk up to Rarity and drape your arms over her. She wraps her arms around your waist in response. You both lean your heads in closer until your lips meet and lock for a good fifteen seconds. After the kiss breaks, Rarity giggles to herself.


"One more kiss, and I'm tied with Applejack," she says.


"You're still hung up on that?" you ask.


"I can't help it." she says. "So...."
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: Spotlight Dance

choices: You have a weird dream about your future with AJ and Rarity.
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
You were a little confused at the question, but you see no reason to say no. Rarity smiles and walks towards the staircase, with you following her. When you both reach her room, you both take a seat on her bed.


"So why did you want us to come up to your room?" you ask.


"Well, I wanted to tell you something that a little... hard to say..." says Rarity. "You know how prom night is a really big night for teenagers right?"


You nod your head.


"And... you know what a lot of teenagers do after the prom, right?" she asks.


You nod your head again, only slower this time. "Yeah, sex," you say.


The unicorn starts to panic. "Yes, but it's not like I... Well, it's just... I..."


"Calm down Rarity," you say. "Just say what you want to say."


Rarity takes a deep breath. "What I'm saying is that... I'm not quite ready for sex yet, but I was hoping if you could..."


"If I could what?" you ask.


Rarity's face turns red as a beet. She's too embarrassed to say it, so she decides to tell you what she wants in a different way. She spreads two of her fingers, brings them to her mouth, and licks in between the two fingers.


Your eyes widen in realization. "Oh," you say. "So that's what you want."


"You don't have to if you don't want to," she says. "I just felt like taking a chance and asking you."


You chuckle. It was cute how shy Rarity was acting over this. "All you had to do was ask," you say. "There was no need to be so nervous."


"Does that mean you'll do it?" she asks.


"I promised myself that I'd make this the best night ever for you, and that includes after the prom," you say. "Truth be told, I'm not ready for real sex either, but I'm totally okay with giving you oral."


"Ughhh!" Rarity says with disgust. "Don't say it like that! It sounds so... disgusting when you say that."


"Sorry," you say.


"So, could you turn around," she asks. "I need to undress." You nod your head, stand up, and turn to face the other direction. You hear the sound of shuffling clothes, and eventually hear the dress plopping on the ground. "Okay," she says, "You can turn around now."


You turn to see Rarity in nothing but her underwear, which was colored black to contrast with her white coat. All you could to was stand there like an idiot as you take in her beauty.


"How do I look?" she asks.


"Gorgeous," you answer, and the unicorn blushes. She sits on the edge of the bed, then lies flat on her back. You walk up to her and get on your knees in front of her. You spread Rarity's legs and slowly pull down her panties. As you were doing this, you feel her legs shaking with nervousness and anticipation.


"If it makes you feel any better, I'm just as nervous as you are right now," you say.


This seems to calm Rarity down, as her legs stop shaking and she lets out a sigh. You then get to work on Rarity, and she lets out a small yelp when you start, but then she relaxes. As you continue, you begin to elicit moans from the unicorn. Her moans become louder, and her hands fiercely grip the bed sheets as her legs move erratically. She then wraps her legs around you, preventing you from stopping until she was satisfied (not like you wanted to, though). Rarity's moans continue to increase in volume, until finally, she lets out one final, climactic moan, her legs tightening their grip on you for several seconds, then going limp.


You get up to see Rarity sprawled out on her bed, panting with exhaustion.


"Oh, darling," she says. "That was just heavenly! It's a good thing my parents and Sweetie Belle aren't home."


"My pleasure, princess," you say, and she blushes at you calling her that. "We're still on for tomorrow, right?"


"Of course," she says. She then hands you a towel and some breath spray. "Here. It's best if you don't make Celestia suspicious when you get home."


"Thanks," you say as you wipe your face and take a few spritzes of breath spray.


"One last thing," says Rarity. She gets up and gives you a quick kiss on the lips. "Now I'm tied with AJ."


You roll your eyes, say your goodbyes, and head back home.


When you get inside, you see Celestia asleep on the couch in the living room. You decide not to wake her up just yet and go upstairs to take a shower and get ready for bed. When you finally get your sleepwear on, Celestia opens the bedroom door.


"Oh, you're home," she says. "How was the dance?"


"Amazing," you say, "but a little exhausting."


Auntie Celeste giggles as you both get into the bed and drift off to sleep.
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: A Special Request

choices: A relationship in which ther're both your legal boyfriends
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content: How weird is the dream?
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: You have a weird dream about your future with A...

choices: Talk to Auntie Celeste about it at breakfast.
Talk to Rarity about it on your date today.
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
You wake up with a loud yawn and rub your eyes. Once your vision clears up, you see that you're in a different room, one that you've never been in before.


"Where the hell am I?" you think. You look to your left and see a lump in the sheets, which means that wherever you are, Celestia is here with you. Could this mean the she took you here? You're about to get your answer as the sheets rustle. Celestia takes the covers off and- wait, that isn't Celestia. That's... that's Rarity! Somehow you ended up in a bed with Rarity, only she looks... different. She seems to have aged a couple years, and her mane is a little longer. You also notice that she was wearing a white negligee with black underwear underneath. You blush a deep red.


"Good morning, sweetheart," she says. "Did you have a good rest?"


"Yeah, I guess so," you say, and your eyes widen at the words you said, or rather, how you said those words. Your voice has gotten deeper. It wasn't by much, but it was still noticeably deeper than last night.


"You seem a little... off this morning, darling," she says.


"Of course he is!" says a voice behind you. It sounded very familiar. All of a sudden, a pair of arms wrap around you from behind and you feel an ample bust press against your back.


"After what we did last night, it's no wonder why poor [your name]'s feelin' out of it," the mare says.


"Applejack?" you ask.


"Who were ya expectin'?" she says as she turns you around. You get a good look at her and see that she looks a few years older, too. Her mane has gotten longer as well, longer than how much Rarity's has grown. You see that she was in her underwear, too. Just what did the three of you do last night?


You rub your forehead for a second. "What day is it?" you ask.


"Look at the calendar, silly," Rarity says with a giggle. You get out of the bed and do just that. You see that it's the same month and day, but your eyes widen at the year. Apparently, this is tomorrow, but three years into the future!


"Since it's my turn to make breakfast, I'll head to the kitchen," says Rarity.


With only you and AJ left in the room, she gets up and walks up to you. "Do ah have to fill ya in on yer entire life like yer some sort of amnesiac?" she asks.


"Not my entire life, but the last couple of years would help," you say.


Applejack chuckles, thinking that you're just playing dumb, but she decides to humor you.


"Well, it all started on the last day of our junior year in high school," she explains. "Ya told Rarity an' me that you couldn't decide who you wanted to be with more, cuz you couldn't imagine life without either of us. Needless to say, it struck a chord with the two of us, so we decided that we'd share ya. After graduation, we decided t' live together in Vanhoover to spend our college years, an' here we are now."


"Thanks, AJ," you say with a smile. "So, what exactly did you, me, and Rarity do last night?"


The cowpony chuckles. "Let's just say you made me an' Rarity feel like real mares."


"Breakfast is ready!" you hear from another room, only it wasn't Rarity's voice. Is sounded more like... Auntie Celeste?


You suddenly wake up in your regular bed, in your regular bedroom, in your regular time. That was a really weird dream. Although... it did get you thinking. Maybe it would be best for you to have both Rarity and Applejack as your girlfriends. You needed to talk to somepony about this, but who?
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: The Man With Two Mares

choices: "I don't think that's a good idea, darling."
"You know, I was thinking the same thing recently..."
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
You sigh. You know that Auntie Celeste is still a little uneasy when it comes to you and other girls. She's a;ready nervous at the thought of you dating one mare, so telling her you might be considering dating two of them might be pushing it.


Still, though, she's said it herself: you can talk to her about anything, and you're sure that dating two mares falls under the category of "anything". When you get to the table for breakfast, you take a deep breath and look at Auntie Celeste.


"Auntie," you say. "I know you don't feel comfortable when I talk about other mares, but..."


"What is it sweetie?" she asks.


"Well, I had this dream," you say. "It was about... well, me... three years from now, living in Vanhoover in an apartment with Applejack... and Rarity. They told me that they were both my girlfriends and it's been like that for years. I must have been stressing out over my relationship with them."


Celestia nods her head and you continue.


"That dream got me thinking," you say. "Is it really that bad if I can't choose between those two? Would having a relationship with both of them be the best thing for us?"


Celestia stays quiet for a moment, then speaks up. "Well, [your name], I don't know about humans, but polyamory isn't uncommon among ponies," she explains. "In fact, I have several friends in Canterlot that are in such relationships. What I'm trying to say is that it's an option, but you have to be sure that it's what you want. More importantly, you need to know if Rarity and Applejack are okay with it as well."


You smile at Celestia. You weren't expecting her to be so calm about this. Could this mean that she's finally gotten over her jealousy? "Thanks, Auntie," you say.


"No problem, sweetheart," she says. "Now you should get ready. You're spending the day with Rarity, aren't you?"


"Oh, man!" you say. "I almost forgot!" you quickly wolf down the rest of your breakfast, and get ready for your date with Rarity.


You make your way to the Carousel Boutique and see Rarity waiting outside for you. She was wearing an ice blue top and a black skirt with white bell bottom pant underneath. "Why hello, darling!" she says, excitedly.


"Hey, Rarity," you say. "You ready to go?"


"Am I ever!" she says. "I have something special planned for us. Since you promised to spend an entire day with me and that where we go is my call, I've decided that we'll be going to Canterlot for the day!"


"Well, that explains why you wanted me to meet you so early," you say. "The train ride is forty minutes long."


"Yep, and we have to get there before we miss it, so let's go," she says as she takes your hand.


The two of you were able to catch the train and find a booth to sit in. Rarity sat on the same side of the booth as you so that she could nuzzle up to you. After you give it a few minutes, you decide to ask her about what she thought about the idea of you dating both her and Applejack.


"Rarity," you say.


"Yes, [your name]?" she answers.


"I've been thinking about this situation between you, me and Applejack," you say, "and this crazy idea came to mind."


"Oh? And what might that be?" asks the unicorn.


"Well, I was thinking about the possibility of the three of us having a... polyamorous relationship..." you say.


What does Rarity say?
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: A Rather Serious Breakfast

1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
"You have?" you ask Rarity.

"Look, darling, I know how difficult it is for a decision for you to make, me or Applejack. So, we were talking last night and we both agreed."

"Rarity, I... I don't know what to say..."

"Oh, it's not a problem, (your name). I know how much we mean to you, so, now you have both of us." Rarity gives you a kiss afterward and cuddles you in the meantime. After a few seconds, she stops. "I hope I don't give you way too many kisses to go way above Applejack, though."

"I can't believe you're still onto that."

"You know me, darling."

You spend the rest of the ride making out, only hoping for a great day today. It was interrupted by...
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: Mutual agreement (sort of)

1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.content:
When you and Rarity finish kissing, she smiles at you warmly for a few seconds, then a devious look appears on her face.


"Now I'm in the lead," she says.


"Does that mean you'll stop keeping count?" you ask.


"Heavens, no," she says. "It's fun keeping count."


You open your mouth to respond, but you're interrupted by a voice on the train's PA system.


"Fillies and gentlecolts, welcome to the mountainside city of Canterlot. For those visiting, welcome. For those returning, welcome back."


"This is our stop," says Rarity. The two of you get off the train and take in the fresh air. "So, where shall we go?" she asks.


"Weren't you the one that planned this trip?" you ask. "Besides, I promised we'd do whatever you want."


"True, but I still wanted to give you a chance to do something you want," she says. "I guess I'm just that... generous."


You chuckle at the remark. True to your word, you let Rarity take you wherever she wanted to go, which just happened to be...
1412121111111221112221112211122221112212.title: Arrival

choices: Your phone rings (Reader's choice who it is).
14121211111112211122211122112.content:
You do a double take when you see what Auntie Celeste was wearing. You could've sworn she was wearing some pastel pink lingerie. After rubbing your eyes to make sure that you were seeing straight, you still see the same thing.


"A-Auntie Celeste!" you say, struggling to form words. "What are you wearing!?"


"Oh, this? This is just something I used to wear when I was younger," she says, as if this were an everyday thing. "I found it lying around in my closet, tried it on, and it still a perfect fit! I was wondering if you could give me your opinion on how it looks on me."


"Um... it looks just fine," you say, facing away from her.


"How can you say that when you're not even looking at me?" she asks, but she sounds like she's... closer.


You turn around and see Auntie Celeste sitting on the bed beside you. How did she get so close to you without making any noise? You were probably too lost in your silent panic to notice.


Celestia wraps an arm around you and pulls you close to her. You were close enough to smell the sweet scent permeating from her long, colorful mane.


"Auntie Celeste," you say, "I think this looks great on you, but I'm feeling kind of uncomfortable right now."


"Oh, there's no reason to be uncomfortable, [your name]," she says wrapping her other arm around you and holding you tighter. "I'm your aunt, and you know I'll always try to make you as comfortable as possible."


All of a sudden-
14121211111112211122211122112.title: Something's Wrong With This Picture

choices: The douchebags that pick on you occasionally.
141212111111122111222111222.content:
“Hello?” you say as you answer the phone.


“[You’re name], darling!” says the pony on the other line. You could tell by her voice that it was Rarity.


“I was so worried when you collapsed last night!” she says. “I thought cider didn’t have alcohol!”


“Apparently it was the ‘Hard Brand’,” you tell her. “You should really be worried about Rainbow Dash.”


“Now that I think about it, I did see a doctor that was heading to her house earlier today…” she says. “Regardless, that’s not the reason why I called. I wanted to let you know that since the prom starts at eight PM this Saturday, you can pick me up around ten minutes before the hour.”


“Sounds good,” you say, not having any problem with that.


“Okay, sweetie. See you at school tomorrow!” she says, and the line goes dead.


Wait a second. Did Rarity just say that the prom was Saturday? You had no idea that the prom was that soon! Then again, all you need to worry about is your tuxedo, which Rarity is most likely taking care of for you.


Despite the massive hangover you had earlier, things were looking up. You have a date to the prom, and there are absolutely no consequences. The only real “problem” you have is whether you’re more in love with Rarity or with Applejack, and the answer will reveal itself in time, so there’s no need to stress about it.


You walk back to the room you here sleeping in and peek though the door to see Applejack hugging her little sister. You can’t help but smile.


“I’m glad to see you guys have finally made up,” you say. “I’m gonna head home, okay?”


“Alrighty then,” says AJ. “You be careful now, ya hear?”


“I will,” you say reassuringly.


“Bye, [your name]!” Applebloom says, with the usual joyful tone back in her voice.


You walk home and decide to just sleep in all day so you can be rested for school the next day.


Speaking of the next day…


You wake up feeling really refreshed, and the smell of breakfast was more than enough to get you out of bed. You take a bath, get dressed, and go downstairs to get breakfast.


“Morning!” says Spike and Twilight.


“Morning, guys,” you say. You eat your breakfast, brush your teeth afterwards and headed out for school.


On the way there, Twilight decides to make some conversation.


“You know, this is the first time we’ve walked to school together in a long time,” she says. You realize she was right. For the past few years, you and Twilight always walked down different routes to school. The last time you walked to school together was in elementary school.


“Well, since we’re on good terms now, we can walk together,” you say. “By the way, thanks again for doing my science project for me.”


“Like I said before,” she says, “it’s no big deal.”


The two of you finally get to school, and since you and Twilight’s lockers were in different areas of the school, you both part ways. While you’re getting some stuff out of your locker, some ponies approaches you. Who are they?
141212111111122111222111222.title: Prom Planning

1412121111111221112221112222.content:
Just when you felt like you where on the top of the world, you came tumbling down as you spot both Dumb-bell & Hoops,

"Aaayyy der Monkey-boy.." said the muscle-headed pony Dumb-bell as his hand slams against your locker. His equaly muscled, but slightly taller friend laughs at the crappy joke. "Eheeh, good one Dumb-bell"

You groan to yourself, you not in the mood for this crap. Dealing with these guys has been a pain in your ass for the past months.

"*sigh* What do you guys want..?" you ask, not hiding the slight irritation in your tone.

The big dumb stallion, Hoops picks up on your irritation & stands in-front of you, his imposing size hangs a shadow over you, using his size to make you feel tiny. "Watch ya tone Monkey-boy.." Hoops says, it would be threatening, but his voice makes him sound like he's been knocked on the head a dozen times.

Dumb-bell, too your surprise, grabs Hoops shoulder. "Easy der, Hoops, we're not here to rough'em dis time remember?" the dark-coated stallion tells his friend. Hoops looks at Dumb-bell till he remembers whatever they planed "Oh right..sorry.." said Dumb-bell. He moves away from you, giving your personal space.

You blink, this is new...they usually would intimidate you, toss you around then ask (demand) you to do their homework.

Dumb-bell coughing in his hands & looks like he's trying out for play, finally opens his mouth & says something.

"Listen eerr..emm uhhh what's ya name again..?"

"Its-"

"Ahh nevamind dat, listen.." Dumb-bell says while scooting closer to you.

"Ya know, we know that ya are friends with Rainbow Crash.."

You correct him "Rainbow *Dash*" you say sourly, you never liked how they called her that.

Dumb-bell shrugs you off "Yeah,yeah whateva, now listen here...since you know Rainbow Dash, I was hoping ya..hook a pony up"

"What....?" you say flatly, he's not serious is he...?

Dumb-bell gives you solid hard glare "Ya heard me Monkey-boy, I want ya to hook me up with Rainbow Cra-Dash for the prom.." he says sternly.

No effin way, does this assclown really think you'll hook him up on a date with one of your friends!? Buck that, you already know Dash hates these clowns since they tease & mock her skills a lot. Shit, you feel bad for Rainbow since she has them in her track team..

Hoops leans over & nudges Dumb-Bell, the dark-coated stallion looks over at his friend curiously as Hoops whispers something in his ears. Dumb-Bell nods "Right right.." he then turn his attention back at you

"Oh, and Hoops wants a date with that Pinkie Pie chick.."

"What!!?" you shout in shock. Oh boy, those protective guy instincts are kicking in, the idea of Pinkie Pie going with that tard is..insulting.

"Yeah, ya heard me Monkey."

You glare at them both & move away from your locker as you get your bag from the floor, you don't care if they grab you or smack you around, you're not getting dates for these jackasses

"Forget you guys, Like hell I'll set you up with my friends" you tell them off.

Big brawn, little brain Hoops snarls & looks like he's gonna charge you, but Dumb-bell blocks him with his arm. "If ya do this...We'll neva bother ya again.."

You feel yourself go rigged at those words, they'll leave you alone....?

"You'll what..?" you ask, even cleaning your ears to be sure the wax wasn't mucking up your hearing.

"Ya heard me Monkey, just get us a date with those girls..and ya'll be home free." Dumb-Bell says as clearly as one can be.

You feel your morals slide to neutral. If you can get these slime-balls date with your two good friends, you'll finally be free from any harassment, you can walk the halls without getting smacked over the head, being called Monkey-boy, getting hit by a football & do their homework.

But Pinkie & Dash are your friends & how the hell will you able to convince them to go with Dumb-bell & Hoops anyway?

Say No, you'll get stuffed in a locker. Say Yes, you'll have an impossible task that will be very very hard to complete..
1412121111111221112221112222.title: Jumping Hoops & Lifting Dumb-Bells

14121211111112211122211122221.content: Do you really mean no, or are you just not sure?
14121211111112211122211122221.title: No?

141212111111122111222111222212.content:
You were at a crossroads here. You can let these a-holes go on one date with your friends, and they'll leave you alone for good, but Rainbow and Pinkie might not talk to you again. You can say no and not put them through a terrible prom date, but then Dumbell and Hoops will continue harassing you, maybe even more so because you said no. There was one question left on your mind.

"How do I know I can trust you?" you ask.


"What?" they both ask.


"Who's to say that you wouldn't keep your word and just keep hassling me, then I would've went through all that trouble for nothing." you explain.


"You'll just have to trust us." says Hoops.


You stay silent for a moment. "I'll give you my answer after I give it some more thought." you say.


"Don't take too long to think it over." says Dumbell.


Later that day, the lunch bell rings and you find Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie walking down the hall. Your plan was to explain your situation and see if they were willing to sacrifice their prom night for you. If they say yes, great. If not, you'll tell them no and endure more harassment until graduation (basically one and a half more years). You're not worried about Pinkie since she says yes to practically anything. It's Rainbow Dash you're worried about.


"Man, that's rough." says Rainbow after you explain everything to her.


"I know..." you say. "It's totally cool if you won't do it. I'll just tell them no if that's the case."


"Nah, I'll take one for the team." she says. "It's just one night. Besides the only thing they can do if you say no is the same thing they've been doing to you for years. You in, Pinkie?"


"Sure!" she answers. "Anything for a friend!"


"Thanks, guys." you say. "I owe you one."


"Nah, that's not necessary." says Rainbow. She really lived up to the element of loyalty.


"Well, I'll be at the prom in case they try anything stupid." you say.


What is your friends' response?
141212111111122111222111222212.title: I'll Get Back to You On That...

choices: "Sorry, you'll just have to wait until the prom."
1412121111111221112221112222122.content:
You should have expected that Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie would become inquisitive once you mention that you're going to the prom.


"You're going with someone!?" they ask simultaneously.


You try to play it off. "I didn't say that I was going with someone. I'm just gonna go to make sure Dumbell and Hoops don't try anything funny."


"Yeah right!" says Rainbow. "I doubt that's the only reason."


"Yeah! My Pinkie Sense says that you're hiding something!" says Pinkie. When you first heard of the Pinkie Sense, you were as skeptical as Twilight was about it. You were eventually convinced that it was real, and the fact that she can tell you're hiding something.


"Okay, you got me." you say. "I'm going with someone, but I'm not telling."


"Well, can we guess?" asks Pinkie.


"Knock yourself out, but I'm not gonna tell you if your guess is right or wrong." you say.


"In that case," says Rainbow, "I'd say you're going with Applejack!"


You stay silent.


"No way!" argues Pinkie. "He's probably taking Rarity. Don't you remember when they were dancing together at the party."


You wince a little at the memory of what happened at that party, but you still stay quiet.


"Oh, please! Rarity is into those rich, prissy boys. If [your name] asked her, she'd turn him down in an instant." argues RD.


That was a rather bittersweet comment. One one hand, what Rainbow said was waaaaaaay off, but at least she doesn't think you're going with Rarity.


"Plus, he's always going to AJ's house after school." she continues. "Probably to make out with her."


You wince again, remembering the two times that AJ kissed you at her house, and that time you almost did... it with her.


"Oh, well." you say. "You'll find out when Saturday comes."


"No way!" Rainbow Dash objects. "You're gonna tell us!"


"Pleasepleasepleasepleasepleeeeeeeeeeeeeeease!!!" pleads Pinkie.


What do you say.
1412121111111221112221112222122.title: You and Your Big Mouth...

choices: Applejack holds your hand under the table.
14121211111112211122211122221221.content:
You decide that it would be better to just tell them. Pinkie Pie would most likely annoy you for months nonstop and Rainbow Dash would most likely beat the answer out of you.


"Fine, I'll tell you." you say. "I'm taking Rarity..." You said it in a really quiet tone reminiscent of Fluttershy.


"What?" the two ponies ask, not hearing you.


"I'm taking Rarity." you say louder.


Rainbow Dash's jaw drops while Pinkie bounces up and down.


"Iknewitiknewitiknewit!!!" she exclaims.


"I can't believe it." says Rainbow in disbelief.


"Now you guys have to keep it on the DL," you say. "I don't want the whole school talking about this."


You then give Pinkie a look. You knew that she had a big mouth.


"Don't you worry about it!" she says. "I won't tell a soul!"


Later, the three of you meet the other at your usual lunch spot. You take a seat and Applejack and Rarity scoot closer to you.


"You don't look so good, Fluttershy." you say.


"I have a chemistry test next period," she says. "I miss tenth grade, when I was taking biology."


"At least you can drown your sorrows in the prom." says Twilight. "It's only five days away."


"And I, for one, can't wait!" Rarity chimes in.


"Does that mean you have a date?" asks Fluttershy.


"Yes, and you'll find out who he is on Saturday night." she says. Rainbow and Pinkie look at each other, because they already knew that Rarity was referring to you.


Just then-
14121211111112211122211122221221.title: I Give Up

choices: "I got you a car that you can use to pick up Rarity!"
141212111111122111222111222212212.content:
Just then, you feel a light tap on the side of your left foot. You don't feel the need to look and see what it was, so you keep eating your lunch. You feel that light tap again, and you just happened to be looking down at the time, so you see that Rarity is playfully kicking your foot with her hoof. You smile lightly as she smiles back at you, but then you quickie remember that you were sitting with five other ponies, including Applejack. How could Rarity be okay with flirting with you so openly?


Well, then again, it's not that open. It's just a little game of footsie. What's the harm in that? You decide to entertain her and kick her hoof back. You couldn't have predicted what happened next.


"Did somepony just kick me?" Fluttershy asks.


Way to go, hotshot. You just kicked the wrong pony. How you managed to do something that stupid is beyond you.


"My bad, Fluttershy," you say. "I was just stretching my legs."


"Oh, okay then." she says with a smile.


You look at Rarity, expecting her to give you one of those "You've got to be kidding me" looks. Instead, she giggles, finding your slight mistake to be cute.


Later on, the school day ends and you go to you locker. As you expected, you get a visit from Dumbbell and Hoops.


"So, have ya made your decision?" asks Dumbbell.


"Yeah," you say. "I'll help you out. I've already asked Rainbow and Pinkie if they'd go with you tow, and they said yes."


"Heh, I thought that we would have to beat a yes out of ya." says Hoops.


"However," you say, ignoring his comment. "If either of you mess with me or try anything with either Rainbow Dash or Pinkie Pie, the deal's off. Got it?"


"Yeah, yeah, sure." says Dumbbell.


You weren't sure if he was being sincere, but you were proven wrong the next day. Dumbbell and Hoops were true to their word and stayed away from you and didn't try any funny business with your friends. You enjoyed the lack of harassment, and this was by far the happiest week of your life. You were even happy enough to bear all of Auntie Celeste's daily phone calls, and she was happy that Dumbbell and Hoops weren't bothering you anymore.


On Saturday morning, you wake up to the smell of breakfast, as usual, and after you ate your fill, there was a knock on the door.


"Delivery for a Mr. [your name] and a Miss Sparkle." says the pony at the door.


You and Twilight look at each other, wondering what you guys received. You open the door and the delivery pony hands the packages to you.


"Oh, it's from Rarity." says Twilight, and the two of you immediately know what she sent you


As expected, you and Twilight received your outfits for the prom, which were really stunning. Twilight's dress was a shade of purple that complemented her coat, and your tuxedo was a great shade of midnight blue, with jewels in the place of buttons.


As you were admiring the outfits you receive a phone call. There's only one pony you know that would be calling this early.


"Morning, Auntie Celeste." you say.


"Good morning to you too, [your name]," she says. "Sorry to call so early, but I have something arranged for your date with Rarity tonight."


"Really? What?" you ask, curious to know what it is.


What is Celestia's response?
141212111111122111222111222212212.title: Flirting Fail

choices: Dumbbell just tried to reach into Rainbow's dress!
Hoops just tried to grope Pinkie!
1412121111111221112221112222122121.content:
"Wait, are you serious!?" you ask in disbelief. Twlilight looks at you, wondering what has you so excited.


"Yep, I'm serious," says Auntie Celeste. "I got you your own car."


"And I get to keep it?" you ask.


"As long as you don't get any tickets and you pay for gas out of your own pocket," she says.


"No problem!" you say. "Thank you so much, Auntie!"


"You're very welcome," she says. "Have a good prom night." She then hangs up.


"What's got you so excited?" asks Twilight.


"Aunt- Princess Celestia got me a car to pick up my date tonight." you say.


"Ohhhhhhh," she says with a suspicious tone. "So you are taking somepony to the prom."


"Why would I go if I wasn't taking somepony?" you ask.


"Well, who is it?" asks Twilight. "Tell me."


"Over my dead body." you say.


"Don't give me any ideas." she says playfully.


Later that evening, you were all dressed and ready to go pick up Rarity. The delivery ponies from Canterlot already dropped off the car, which was a beautiful red sports model. You set off for the Carousel Boutique and reach there in three minutes as opposed to the fifteen it would take to walk there. You get out of the car and knock on the door. The door opens not too long afterwards.


"Hi, Sweeite Belle." you say to the filly that answers the door. "Is your sister home?"


"Rarity!" she calls out. "Your boyfriend's here!"


"Very funny," says Rarity as she walks out from the hallway, making her way towards the door. She was wearing an elegant red dress with a shawl to match.


"He is not my boyfriend." she says before closing the door.


"Not officially, at least," she says to you in a quiet tone.


"Well, your chariot awaits," you say as you open the passenger door for Rarity.


"A gift from your 'Auntie', I presume." she says jokingly. You don't normally address Celestia as your aunt in front of your friends, but you accidentally did that in front of Rarity, and she occasionally teases you about it.


The two of you finally reach the school and make your way to the gymnasium, where the prom is being held. There was a festive atmosphere and lights everywhere.


"I forgot to tell you," you say to Rarity, "You look beautiful tonight."


Rarity chuckles. "Better late than never."


You find your friends, and they're all surprised that you and Rarity were going together. Well, everyone except Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie, and Twilight kind of suspected that you two would be going together. The music livens up all of a sudden, and Rarity pulls you onto the dance floor.


"I guess you're itching to dance," you say.


"I guess I am," she says.


Soon the music slows down again, and Rarity pulls you close to her.


"Oh, this is so romantic." she says, more to herself than to you.


"Well, I wanted to make this night perfect," you say.


"It's more than perfect." she replies.


Just then, you hear a yell. "Hey!" the voice said. You recognize who the voice belonged to, as well. What happened?
1412121111111221112221112222122121.title: Aunts With Benefits

choices: - keep walking, but one of your friends punches him (Reader's choice who it is).
14121211111112211122211122221221212.content:
You feel your blood boil when you see Hoops trying to grope one of your best friends. You were nice enough to let that douche go out with her, and THIS is how he repays you? Then again, you should’ve known that this might happen. Dumbbell and Hoops aren’t what you’d call trustworthy.


“Was that… Pinkie Pie?” asks Rarity.


“Stay here, Rarity,” you say. “I have something I need to take care of…”


You stomp over to the two ponies and stand in front of Pinkie, blocking Hoops from touching her again.


“What the hell do you think you’re doing?!” he asks.


“[Your name]! Thank goodness!” says Pinkie.


“I should ask you the same thing, Hoops,” you say. “You think you can get away with feeling up on one of my friends? You’re lucky that I won’t beat you down right now!” At this point, everypony’s eyes were on the three of you.


“This isn’t any of your business, Monkey-boy, so fuck off!” he yells. “I dare you to try and hit me!”


”[Your name], don’t do it!” yells Fluttershy from the crowd, which was a shocker to everyone. Soon your other friends followed suit.


"Don't stoop to that ruffian's level!" yells Rarity.


“Yeah! That asshole isn’t worth it!” Rainbow Dash adds.


“Just walk away,” Twilight chimes in.


You’re about to do just that, until Hoops says one last thing.


“Ha! Go ahead and let these little fillies tell you what to do,” he says. “I knew you didn’t have the guts.”


You hear this and you-
14121211111112211122211122221221212.title: Look, Don't Touch!

141212111111122111222111222212212121.content:
The anger you had never matched to anything before. With that being said, you couldn't contain yourself from not hitting hoops. So while you less Pinkie Pie away, in a swift motion, you spin to the left, with your left hand clenched, and deck Hoops' face, using your right to uppercut him afterwards, causing for you to spin around in a corny way, and for Hoops to fall backwards, jaw broken.

"I've had enough of you two," you state. "First by always bring Rainbow Dash down especially in really bad times, for always bullying me and others, and for you to betray my trust. Well, that's it! You better start running out of here before things really get out of hand!"

Dumbbell and Hoops oblige, everyone thinking that retaliation would occur. But then their attention all focuses on you. Especially Rarity, and your closer pony friends. At least something eased off your troubles.

But of all people, Rainbow Dash walks up to you. She eyes you with a perplexed look before squinting her usual stare. Then she starts laughing, shaking her head.

"Wow, (your name), I never knew you even had the guts to beat Hoops' face in! You're insane!"

Soon, other follow suit and congratulate you on what they thought was impossible. Pinkie Pie pulls you aside and huge you very tightly.

"Oh, thankyouthankyouthankyou so much, (your name)!" She lets go.

"No problem, Pinkie Pie. Either way, he went too far. I had to stop him."

"(Giggle) I'll see you later!" Then she kisses your cheek, as a token of her gratitude. Pinkie then bounces off.

You smile and shake your head once she left. "Oh, Pinkie..."

"Feeling sentimental, are we?" Rarity asks.

"You knew I had to. What else could I have done?"

"Just walked away and..." Rarity kisses you. Again, bittersweet. Prom night was a supposed favor and Rarity really likes you, them again, you and Applejack were a bit closer.

Once you let go, you and Rarity starring walking to the dance floor, now that the tension is gone. It was an enjoyable night.
141212111111122111222111222212212121.title: - sock Hoops in the face!

choices: One of your other pony friends!
1412121111111221112221112222122121211.content:
Before you know it, the prom ends, and it was time to take Rarity home. The two of you waved goodbye to your friends and you drove Rarity back to the Carousel Boutique. You take the unicorn by the hand and walk her to the door.


"Such a gentleman," she says, looking away from you and blushing.


"Well, I wanted this night to be perfect from beginning to end," you say.


"[Your name]," says Rarity. "I got to go to the prom with you. It couldn't have been any more perfect than that."


Now it was your turn to blush. You were flattered that a beautiful mare like Rarity loved you that much.


"And another thing," she adds. "I think it was really brave of you to stand up to hoops like that. I normally wouldn't condone violence, but in this case, I think it's more than excusable. You're not just any regular guy, [your name], you're a hero."


You open your mouth to thank her for the compliment, but Rarity places her finger on your lips, leans her head in closer to yours, and softly kisses you on the lips. As the seconds slowly pass, the two of you wrap your arms around each other, neither of you wanting this moment to end. It does end eventually, though, as you both needed some air. All of a sudden, you hear some hoofsteps close by, and you both realize that somepony saw you two kissing! Who is it?
1412121111111221112221112222122121211.title: After prom...

choices: Pinkie Pie finishing up some cupcakes using her newest recipe!
141212111111122111222111222212212122.content:
You just keep walking, leading Pinkie away from Hoops. You hear him start to say something else before the sound of a fist hitting flesh cut him off. Spinning around, you see Rainbow Dash, standing over Hoops after decking him in the face. "Looks like the tough guy has a glass jaw," Dash says with a disdainful look at Hoops and his friend. "You two are unbelievable. I can put up with Dumb-Bell trying and failing to make a move, but trying to grope one of my friends and insulting another is just too far. If I were in your shoes, I'd be making tracks fast."

Seeing Rainbow Dash mad was a new experience. She had gotten angry in bursts before, but you had never seen her truly mad at someone. Her voice had never risen in volume, but her fists stayed clenched. Dumb-Bell helped Hoops up off the ground and they both left in a hurry. "Thanks a lot, Dash," you say, walking over with Pinkie in tow.

"Don't mention it," the pegasus replied, finally smiling again. "Those two jerks had it coming anyway. I'd like to say they'll learn something, but I think Hoops' head is much harder than his jaw."

"Thanks guys," Pinkie Pie said, beaming and giving you a big hug before hugging Dash.

Pinkie Pie tugs you off to one side as you start back to Rarity and speaks to you privately. "Thanks again for helping me," she says. "It was really cool how you stood up to Hoops like that and didn't hit him."

"He stepped over the line," you reply with a simple shrug.

"I know," she says, smiling again. "And since you're my friend, I wanna thank you. If you can make it, come by Sugarcube Corner after the prom."

"I'll try," you say, causing her beam and bounce off. The poofey dress hid it, but you knew Pinkie Pie had a voluptuous figure and that she was "bouncy" in several places, having stared at her bust and butt several times before.

The rest of the night went divinely. You shared another dance with Rarity and had fun with your friends despite the earlier hiccup. As the night winded down, everyone started to go home. You drive Rarity back to her boutique and walk her to the door. "The night was divine, darling," she says with a smile, "I am so happy we were able to go together."

"It was great," you agree with a nod, "except for that one part."

"Pish, don't worry about that," Rarity says with a dismissive wave, "Rainbow handled it better than any of us could have."

You share a warm hug with Rarity before she goes inside for the night. You get back in your car and decide to pay Pinkie a visit since it was still relatively early and she had asked you to. You drive over to Sugarcube Corner and knock on the front door. "It's open~" came Pinkie's sing-song reply.

When you opened the door you saw...
141212111111122111222111222212212122.title: - keep walking, but one of your friends punches...

1412121111111221112221112222122121222.content:
As you open the door, a heavenly scent hits you. You see Pinkie Pie taking something out of the oven, but she was too far away for you to clearly see what she was cooking.


“Remember when I told you that I was working on a new cupcake recipe last week?” she asks as she sees you come in.


“Yeah…” you say.


“Well, I finally perfected it, and you’re gonna be the first one to try it,” she says.


“So basically, I’m you’re guinea pig?” you ask.


“Don’t think of it like that,” she says, giggling.


“Seriously though, they smell delicious,” you say.


“Thank you!” she says. “I’ll put these in a bag for you. I wouldn’t want you to get crumbs in your new car.”


You wonder how Pinkie knew that you got a new car, and then it hits you. “Pinkie sense?” you ask.


“No,” she bluntly answers. “I can see it through the window.”


You look behind you and see your car as clear as day through said window. “Oh, right,” you say, feeling pretty dumb.


You take the cupcakes, say goodbye to Pinkie, and set off for home.


Once you get home, you see that Twilight was already there and dressed in her pajamas. "What took you so long?" she asked.


"Oh, Pinkie Pie wanted to give me these muffins she made for me," you say. "It's a new recipe she's trying out."


"Can Spike and I have one?" she asks.


"I don't see why not." you say, and you give one cupcake to Twilight, and another to Spike. By the looks on their faces, you could tell that they loved them.


"These are great!" says Twilight.


"Yeah!" says Spike. "Can I have another one?" Twilight gives him a look. "Never mind."


You go to bed after you put the rest of the cupcakes in the fridge. The next morning, as you wake up, you receive a phone call. Who's it from?
1412121111111221112221112222122121222.title: Pinkie's Guinea Pig

14121211111112211122211122221221212221.content:
“Hello?” you say as you answer the phone.


“Howdy, Sugarcube!” says the southern belle on the other line. “How was the prom last night?”


You had to be careful here. While you know that Applejack wants to know that you had a good time, you don’t want to go on and on about how much fun you had with Rarity. You don’t want to stir up any jealousy.


“It was great,” you say. “I had a good time.”


“Well that’s nice to hear,” she says.


“There was one little… ‘incident,’ though,” you say.


“What do ya mean?” asks AJ.


“Hoops tried to have his way with Pinkie Pie last night, but Rainbow Dash and I took care of it,” you explain.


“It’s a good thing you guys were there, then,” she says. “So… I wanted to ask you somethin’.”


“Really?” you ask. “What?”


“I know this is a little short notice, but I was wonderin’ if you’d like to go out for dinner with me tonight,” she says. “It’s nothin’ fancy, just the local diner. Big Mac finally came back home, so he can watch Applebloom while I'm gone.”


“I’d love to go with you,” you say in a heartbeat. “You want me to pick you up?”


“Sure,” she says. “I was thinkin’ we could go for around six-thirty.”


“Sounds like a plan,” you say. “By the way, how’s Applebloom doing?”


“A lot better since you talked to her the other day,” she says.


“That’s good to know,” you say. You were relieved that Applebloom was doing okay. It surprised you that just talking to her was all it took to get her back on her feet.


“I’ll see ya tonight!” says Applejack.


“See ya,” you say.


You head towards your bedroom door, and when you open it, you see Twilight there.


“Hey, I was going to wake you up,” she says. “So who beat me to it?” She’s obviously asking who you were talking to on the phone.


“Oh, it was Applejack,” you say. “She wanted to meet up with me tonight.”


Twilight has a quizzical look on her face. “For what?” she asks.


“I don’t know, Mother. I’ll let you know when I find out,” you say sarcastically.


“Ha, ha, ha,” she says. “Anyway, breakfast is ready.”


You look at Twilight as she makes her way down the stairs. You can tell that she’s suspicious of you; that she can sense that something’s going on between you, Applejack and Rarity. While Pinkie Pie is the nosiest of your friends, and while Twilight usually stays out of other people’s business, you know that when Twilight wants to find something out, she does whatever she can to do so. You need to be wary of her.


The day goes by rather quickly, and before you know it, you were parked outside Sweet Apple Acres, picking up Applejack.


"Nice car you got there," she says.


"Yeah," you say. "Celestia spoils me way too much."


"I'll say," she says.


The two of you set off for the diner, and when you get there, Applejack stands close to you as you both walk inside. Unbeknownst to either of you, somepony was spying on you. Who is it?
14121211111112211122211122221221212221.title: Suspicions Arise

choices: You see Twilight across the room!
Twilight confronts you right then and there!
141212111111122111222111222212212122211.content:
Neither you nor Applejack was aware of the fact that Twilight Sparkle was following you. Not only that, but she’s been following you since your car passed the treehouse. She was able to use her teleportation spell to keep up with you two.


Still oblivious to your “shadow,” you and Applejack walk into the diner, get seated, and order your food. It was gonna be awhile before the food came, so you and AJ decide to chat while you wait.


“So, tell me what happened between Hoops and Pinkie in detail,” she says, still curious of what went down.


You proceed to tell her everything.


“So I see him, and I say ‘Hey, what’s going on?’ And then Hoops tells me to back off, then I told him, he shouldn’t be touching Pinkie like that, and then he tell me that it’s not any of my business and that he dares me to do something about it.”


“So you gave ‘im what for?” AJ guesses.


“I was going to, at first, but I decided not to,” you say. “Either way, Rainbow Dash took care of him for me.”


“Well, that was mighty mature of you to walk away,” she says, “and I’m sure Pinkie Pie is really grateful.”

“She actually gave me some cupcakes as a thank-you gift,” you say. “It’s this new recipe she’s trying out, and they’re really good. I still have some in the fridge at home, and I can get one for you on our way back.”


“You reckon leaving those cupcakes in the fridge, unguarded from Spike, is a good idea?” asks Applejack.


“Twilight put an anti-dragon force field around them,” you say.


“She always thinks of everything, doesn’t she?” she says.


“That she does,” you agree.


 “Well, I need to go use the little filly’s room,” says Applejack. “’Scuse me for a sec.”


“Sure,” you say. While Applejack is in the restroom, something happens that scares you half to death!
141212111111122111222111222212212122211.title: Twilight Sparkle: Private Investigator

choices: You get rid of Twilight before AJ gets back.
You aren't able to get rid of her before AJ gets back.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
You patiently wait for Applejack to come back from using the restroom, when all of a sudden, somepony approaches you from out of nowhere. Somepony that you knew.


"Aha! I knew something was up!" the pony says.


"Twilight!" you say in surprise. "What the hell are you doing here!?"


"I saw you on your way here with AJ, and-"


"And you stalked us here?" you say, interrupting her. "Don't you have a better way to spend a Sunday?"


"This isn't about me," says Twilight. "What are you doing here with Applejack? I thought you were with Rarity?


"We've been over this, Twi," you say. "I took Rarity to the dance because she asked me to take her as a favor to her."


"Oh yeah? What about that party at Sugarcube Corner where the two of you were slow dancing?" she asks.


"Oh, so I slow dance with somepony of the opposite sex, and all of a sudden, we're together," you say sarcastically.


"Whatever," says Twilight, who finally puts that issue to rest, only to bring up another. "That still doesn't explain why you're here with AJ."


The two of you go back and forth, with you trying to get Twilight to go away before Applejack gets back, but do you succeed?
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Surprise Interrogation

choices: You see Twilight in the bushes. She saw and heard everything!
You get a call from Auntie Celeste.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
It seemed as though Twilight would never give this up. Whenever you answered a question of hers, she shot another one at you.


“So what happened between you, Rarity, and Applejack at that party?” she asks.


“What is this? An interview?” you ask back. “Go home, Twilight!”


Unexpectedly, Twilight relents. “Fine, but this isn’t over,” she says. Just as she leaves the table, you see Applejack coming out of the bathroom.


“You seem kinda stressed, hon,” she says. “Is everything alright?”


“Oh yeah,” you lie. “I was just… in thought…”


“Lemme guess,” she says. “You’re wonderin’ when our food’s gonna get here?”


Your face brightens up as AJ inadvertently gave you an alibi. “Yep, that’s exactly it.”


“Spoken like a true boy. Always thinkin’ with yer stomach,” she says with a giggle.


You and Applejack finally get your food, eat your fill, and leave the restaurant once the bill was paid (You and Applejack split the bill).


After you leave the restaurant, you drop off AJ at Sweet Apple Acres. Before she heads inside, however, she notices that you were deep in thought, this time for real.


“Somethin’ on your mind, sugarcube?” she asks.


“Well, I was thinking about how I like both you and Rarity,” you say, “and the more I think about it, the more unsure I am over who I like more.”


“Maybe you should stop thinkin’ so much and just let the answer come nat’rally,” Applejack suggests. “Both Rarity and I understand how hard a decision this is for ya, so we ain’t gonna rush ya.”


“Thanks, AJ,” you say.


“No problem, tiger,” she says, and she gives you a quick peck on the lips before heading into her house. She then pokes her head out the door and says “See ya at school tomorrow!”


This makes you think. Applejack’s kissed you three times now, and Rarity’s only kissed you once. You wonder if the score will even up soon. You turn around to go back to your car when-
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Just In Time

1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
You hope to Celestia that what you’re seeing is just a mirage. You see a figure hiding in the bushes on the other side of the road. You can’t see who it is, but you can tell that it’s a unicorn. Hopefully, it isn’t the unicorn you think it is.


Only one way to find out.


You pick up a pebble from the ground and throw it at the unicorn. “Ow!” it says.


Damn it. You recognize the voice.


“Twilight!” you quietly scream. “I thought I told you to quit spying on me!”


“No you didn’t. You told me to go home,” she says, correcting you. “I did, and now I’m following you again.”


“Why are you suddenly so interested in my social life?” you ask. “I already have Celestia for that. Are you seventeen or seven?”


“Forget about me. What about you?” she asks back. “You’re no saint either, [your name]. Why the hell are you juggling two ponies?”


“I am not!” you say. “You heard what AJ said. I don’t know whether I like her or Rarity more. Secondly, they’re both aware of this and are totally fine with it. Lastly, I’m not in a legit relationship with either of them, so I’m not ‘juggling’.”


“Well, I wouldn’t have to spy on you if you just told me.” Twilight argues.
