“Why did I have to tell you when it wasn’t any of your business, anyway?” you ask. “This has nothing to do with-”


Realizing that there’s no point in continuing this argument, you stop mid-sentence.


“You know what, forget it,” you say. “I’m going home.”


You get in your car, and take off for home. Twilight didn’t bother asking for a ride, but in all honesty, you probably wouldn’t have given her one if she asked. This was just perfect. You had finally rekindled your friendship with Twilight, and she had do go and fuck it up. If only she had just minded her own business. You just hope to Celestia that she doesn’t tell your other pony friends. If she did, then they’d practically interrogate you, Applejack, and Rarity, and you don’t want to put them through that. Not to mention that it would be the worst Monday ever.


The next day at school, you find out that-
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Some Ponies Just Don't Give Up

1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
The minute you enter the school, you just wait for one of your friends to come up and say "Hey, is it true what twilight said about you, Applejack and Rarity?" Needless to say, you're on edge this Monday morning. As you get to your locker, you're approached by Fluttershy.


"Um, [your name]?" she says quietly. "Can I ask you something?"


Oh Luna, here it comes.


"I'm having a sleepover at my house this Friday, and I was wondering if you wanted to come," she says.


This was unexpected for two reasons. One, you were sure that Fluttershy was going to inquire about your... situation. Maybe Twilight didn't tell anyone. Two, usually when the girls had sleepovers, it was mares only. They were usually at either Pinkie Pie's or Twilight's place. Auntie Celeste would let you and Spike crash at the Canterlot Castle when the sleepover at Twilight's. So this was not only the first time Fluttershy was hosting the sleepover, but also the first time you were invited. Maybe the girls can finally trust you to go to a sleepover with them without being suspicious of you trying something sleazy. You would never do that, though, mainly because one of six things would happen:


1. Twilight would give you a harsh scolding.

2. Rainbow Dash wold beat the shit out of you.

3. Fluttershy would never look at you the same way again.

4. Pinkie would blab to everypony in Ponyville about it.

5. Applejack and Rarity would dump your sorry ass.

6. All of the above.


Given those possibilities, it wouldn't be worth it to try anything stupid.


You accept Fluttershy's invitation, and as she walks away, another pony approaches you.


"Hey Twilight," you say, trying not to sound bitter.


"Hi, [your name]," she says. "I was hinking about what you said last night... and you were right. I shouldn't have spied on you and Applejack. It wasn't any of my business. Your secret's safe with me."


A smile grows on your face. "Thanks Twilight," you say. "By the way, are you going to Fluttershy's sleepover?"


"Yeah, you?" she asks.


"How did you know that I was invited?" you ask back.


"It was my idea to invite you in the first place," she says with a wink.


You smile at Twilight again and wrap your arm around her. "Aww, thanks 'little sis'." you say.


"You're only two months oder than me," she says matter-of-factly.


"Whatever," you say. Just then, the warning bell rings which means that everypony now has two minutes to get to class. "I should get going," you tell Twilight.


The day goes by smoothly, and when the last bell rings, you go to your looker and get all the books you needed to do your homework for the night. Just when you start walking out the school doors to your car, you're stopped by two ponies. Who are they?
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Silence is Golden

choices: One of your pony friends (reader's choice who it is).
Auntie Celeste, checking up on you yet again.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
"Hey, Monkey-Boy!" you hear somepony yell. You give an annoyed sigh and turn around to see Dumbbell and Hoops walking towards you. You were hoping to not have to deal with them for at least a few weeks because of what happened at the prom. Maybe Rainbow Dash didn't punch Hoops hard enough.


"What now?" you ask.


"We want to talk to you about what happened at prom!" says Dumbbell.


"Yeah, like how you ruined it for us!" Hoops added.


"Last time I checked, I wasn't the one who tried to manhandle Pinkie Pie, and I wasn't the one who punched Hoops in the face," you say. "I did what you guys asked me to do. I got Rainbow and Pinkie to go out with you, and you two are lucky for that alone. Don't blame what happened on me just because you guys couldn't keep your hands to yourselves."


You don't know why, but you felt confident today. You felt that with all you went through, Dumbbell and Hoops weren't worth stressing out over. The two ponies look at you, surprised that you have the nerve to talk to them like that.


"Now, if you'll excuse me," you say, "I've got to get home. I have homework to do."


As you walk back to your car, all you hear is Dumbbell shouting out a bunch of threats at you. You aren't really paying attention, so you only catch bits and pieces of what he says. When you get home, you get all your homework done and pour a bowl of pretzels to eat on the couch. You always thought that snacks tasted better right after homework. All of a sudden, your phone rings. Who's on the other line?
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Just the Ponies I DON'T Want to See

choices: try being with just AJ, then try Rarity, then you'll know who's the one."
there's nothing wrong with a polyamorous relationship."
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
"Hello?" you say into the phone as you answer.


"Oh, hi, [your name]," says the pony on the other line. You can tell by the voice that it was.


"Hey, Fluttershy," you say. "What's up."


"Oh, nothing," she says. "It was just that I told you what day the sleepover was, but I had forgotten to tell you exactly what time. I was thinking around... seven?"


"Sounds good," you say. "By the way, can I tell you something. It's kind of important."


You had been debating over whether or not to tell Fluttershy about your situation with Applejack and Rarity for a while now. At first you thought it was a bad idea because besides you and your two "mare friends", Twilight knows about it as well, and you got lucky when she didn't tell anypony. Do you really want to risk having your secret exposed again?


Then you thought about it some more. This is Fluttershy we're talking about. What are the odds of her telling anypony? You might as well take advantage of the fact that you're one of the few people of the opposite sex that she feels totally comfortable around. Plus, she might have some insight on the issue.


"Lately, I've been having this problem," you begin. "There are these two girls, mares, to be exact, and I like both of them. They both know that I have feelings for both of them, and the fact that they both like me back doesn't make things any easier. I just can't imagine being without either of them, but I don't think it's fair to them that I keep them waiting this long."


Fluttershy stays quiet for a moment and says, "If I may ask, [your name]," she says. "who are these two mares?"


You pause for a second. "Applejack and Rarity," you say.


"Oh..." says Fluttershy. There's a dead silence. Who could blame her. It's not like she was expecting you to say that the two mares you're torn between just happen to be two of her best friends. Just then, she speaks up again.


"I should have seen this coming," she says. "You're always spending time with AJ, and I had a feeling that you taking Rarity to prom was more than just a favor to a friend."


Looking back on it now, you've made it a little obvious that you had some kind of special feelings for Applejack and Rarity. "What do you think I should do?" you ask.


"Well, [your name]..."
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Advice

choices: Go for both and see which way it goes!
No you can't bear two hearts on one man.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
"Huh?...wait you mean that there actual such things for anypony?"you question to yourself and Fluttershy

"W-well not many pony do so well least not around Ponyville,and due to the fact that herds are normally be around 5 or 6 other mares..." she says.

After those words were spoken you had a surge of thoughts over whether to consider asking Rarity, or Applejack such as thing for both (or possibly more?) into your lives in such a relationship. Though would it fine?Also would it they stay in Ponyville afterwards? After all high school will be ending nearly soon to having such herd in Ponyville. To many questions only a few ways to answer them by considering what Fluttershy mention.

All that is left to do either set up a meeting and call to set up a meeting to then ask them for them all be together, or consider you might not like one of your two debatable marefriends in a serious relationship for a herd.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: there's nothing wrong with a polyamorous re...

1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
You can tell from the ringtone that the call was from Auntie Celeste.


"Hello?" you say.


"Hi, [your name]!" says the princess, with the same cheerful tone she uses whenever she calls you. "How are you? I'm just dying to know how the prom went!"


"It was great, Aunt C!" you say. "Best night of my life! Thanks again for the car."


"Anything for my favorite 'nephew'!" she says. You roll your eyes at the way she spoke as if you were actually related to her. "So, besides the prom, has anything new happened lately?"


"Well, for some reason, I was invited to one of the girls' sleepovers," you answer.


"Oh, really?" she asks in disbelief. "Well lucky you! You get to go to a sleepover with six beautiful ponies." her voice then turns rather mischievous. "Don't get too frisky, now."


A chill goes up your spine when you hear her say that. Why does Celestia have to take things to such a dark place all the time?


"Why do you have to take things to such a dark place all the time?" you ask.


"Because imagining the look on your face every time I do so crack me up." she says laughing. "Honestly though, have fun."


"I will. Bye," you say as you hang up the phone.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Auntie Celeste, checking up on you yet again.

choices: They decide to play Truth or Dare, and you're going first.
They decide to give you a makeover.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
Friday night comes faster than you expected. Before you know it, you're driving to Fluttershy's cottage with Twilight in the passenger's seat.


"I hope you didn't invite me just so I could give you a ride," you say to her.


"Of course not," she says. "I can tell that you've been wondering what we do at our sleepovers, and after talking it over with the girls, we decided to let you come over this time."


When the two of you finally reach the cottage, you walk up to the door. As you do just that, two different voices in your head say different things.


"Well, this was nice of the girls to invite me to their sleepover," the first voice says. "This should be fun."


"What the fuck am I doing here?" says the second voice. "I appreciate the invite, but why did I agree to go to a girl's sleepover!?"


You finally knock on the door, and Fluttershy answers. "Oh, Twilight and [your name]." she says. "Please come in."


You both walk in, and see that you were the first to arrive, but the other ponies get there shortly. As they all arrive, you go into thought yet again. You realize that your pony friends know at least something about your situation with AJ and Rarity. Twilight knows pretty much everything, and Rainbow Dash, Fluttershy, and Pinkie Pie know that you took Rarity to prom. You need to play your cards right and make sure that nopony finds out until you decide who you like more.


"So, what should we do first, ladies?" asks Rarity.


What decision do the girls come to?
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Sleepover Night

1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
The girls eventually agree on Truth or Dare, a reasonable decision. However, you get anxious when they decide that you're going first. Rainbow Dash volunteers to ask you the infamous "Truth or Dare" question.

"So, [your name]," she says. "Truth or Dare?"
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Truth or Dare

choices: "What's going on between you, Applejack and Rarity?"
"Who do you have a crush on?"
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content: You somewhat regretted by saying "Truth", but you don't have much to worry about. But that backfired when Rainbow Dash asks the question...
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Truth

choices: ...she asks Applejack, knowing that she's a terrible liar.
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
Knowing Rainbow Dash, you kind of had a feeling that she would ask you this, so you were semi-prepared to answer this. You decide to act as though you were perplexed by the question.


"What would make you think that anything is going on, Rainbow Dash?" you ask. Rarity and Applejack look at you, relieved that you didn't reveal the secret between the three of you.


But Rainbow Dash won't give up that easily. "Don't give me that crap!" she says. "If nothing is going on, explain why you almost always go to AJ's place after school?"


"I thought we were past this already, Rainbow," you say.


"Yeah, what's wrong with visiting a friend?" asks Twilight, who's doing her best to cover for you.


"Okay, what about the party at Sugarcube Corner?" Rainbow continues. "Explain that little slow dance you had with Rarity."


"She asked me to dance with her!" you argue. "What was I gonna do, say no?"


"In his defense, it was the gentlemanly thing to do," says Fluttershy. She isn't completely aware of what's going on, but you're glad to have somepony else on your side.


Rainbow Dash starts to growl in frustration. "Well, what about prom?!" she shouts.


"Rarity didn't want to go alone, so she asked me to go with her," you say. "She never intended for it to be a real date."


"If that's the case, then why did she choose you over all the other guys in school?" she asks.


"I don't know," Rarity asks sarcastically. "Maybe it's because I trust him?"


"Or because you LIKE him!" Rainbow says in an accusatory tone.


"I think you need to chill out, RD," says Pinkie Pie. "You're ruining the game."


"So what?" she asks. "There's something going on and I want to know what it is!"


"Well, you can do that on yer own time," says Applejack. "For now, let's just continue the game."


Rainbow Dash stays quiet for a minute and...
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: What is This, a Police Interrogation?

choices: ... somepony says to Rainbow, "Why is it so important to you?"
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
"You know, I've heard from everyone here, except Applejack," Rainbow Dash starts. Applejack's and your eyes become bug eyed when RD says that. You were hoping that the cowpony can be able to squirm herself out of this. But it was extremely unlikely since Applejack's element is Honesty.

"What else do ya need t' know, Rainbow?" Applejack calmly states. "If (your name) comes over its to help me with the math or keep an eye on Applebloom while I work around th' farm." At least that part is true.

"Oh, really? Is there anything else to why he visits?" Rainbow asks.

You knew she couldn't take it. Applejack was sweating badly and getting nervous. You quickly needed an alibi. But just then...
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: Honesty isn't always a virtue

choices: No one gives a second glance to the situation
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.content:
If it wasn't for your quick thinking of dialing her, the three of you were screwed. Luckily, it evaded the question. Applejack pick up her phone and sees that its you, but tries to make believe its her sister.

"Why, hey there, Applebloom," she somewhat casually greets. She looks at you and you mouth the words, "go outside."

"Okay, just a minute. Sorry, girls, but I have t' take this outside." The cowpony walks out, hangs up, and sighs then calls you back.

Somehow confused by why she came out, the other ponies let it slide. But your phone rings, nearly surprisingly everyone. You pick it up and check to see who it is. But to avoid any further questions, you pretend it's the princess.

"Well, what do you know?" you said. "Hello, Princess Celestia."

"(Your name), please meet me outside," Applejack says.

"Okay, one second, please. Private matter, guys. I'll be back." You walk upstairs to Fluttershy's balcony and resume talking. "You alright, Applejack?"

"Yeah. Thanks a plenty, sugarcube. I wouldn't know what I'd do if Rainbow kept goin' on."

"Dont worry; hopefully she drips the subject when we come back inside."

"I hope so too." You both hang up and come back inside. After you're all accounted for...
1412121111111221112221112222122121222112.title: ... Applejack's phone rings.

choices: They can't find her at all.

"Lucky," you say. The unicorn smiles, then leaved the library, leaving you alone. After you make sure you have everything (phone, keys, etc.), you start for the door, but then somepony knocks on the door. You open the door and see Applejack and Rarity standing there.


"Hey, you two," you say. "What brings you guys here?"


"Well, we were wonderin' if ya wanted t' walk to school with us today, sugarcube!" says Applejack.


"We'd really like it if you accompanied us," says Rarity.


"Why not?" you ask, and the three of you set off for school. Luckily, Spike wasn't awake yet, so he didn't see Rarity. As the three of you walked to school, Rarity starts talking about prom.


"I just wanted to thank you again for agreeing to take me to prom, [your name]," she says.


"Oh, so you did ask 'im?" asks AJ.


"Sort of," says the unicorn. "I had apologized to him over the phone, and he put the offer on the table."


"It was nothing," you say with a blush.


"I was thinking, Applejack," says Rarity, "what if [your name] took both of us to prom?"


What does Applejack say?
14121211111121111212211222222.title: An Interesting Walk

14121212.content:
you though, and placed the phone in your pocket, as you walked inside again.

"who was it, sugarcube?" applejack asks with a worried tone.

"oh. eh.. n-n-nothing! nothing at all!" you say and walks over to applejack ad sit down. "so..." you start "what did i miss?"

"oh. ehm.. well... eeeeeeeeeeeeehh... black snake, the bad guy, have just kidnaped jenny. and the mysterious stranger, the good guy, is chasing after them!" applejack says

"oh, ok. cool. well. lets watch!" you say and get comfortable.

"ok. but..." applejack stops.

"what's the matter, applejack?" you ask her, with a worried tone.

"well... it's just that... ah REALLY want ta know what's wrong! who was it that called ya?" applejack asks you, and looks at you, with a worried face!

"oh. it's nothing!" you say. trying to brush it off!

"please tiger! tell me!" applejack say's, and looks at you with pleading eyes!

do you tell her?
14121212.title: "I can't just dump AJ now. i'll ask her tomorrow!"

choices: tell the truth "everypony asked me to help them today, but i chose YOU!"
LIE! "no, nothing! i was just wondering who to VISIT,thats all!"
141212121.content:
"ok, fine applejack!" you say and pause the film. "it was twilight!"

"ah should have guessed!" applejack interrupts you! "she's ALWAYS tryin ta keep ya away from me!"

"WHAT??!! SHE IS??!!" you though, and asks applejack. "what?! she is?!" more CALMLY, as to not SCARE her!

"ye! haven't ya noticed??!" applejack asks surprised. "she's always trying that makeya be with somepony ELSE than me!" she says, and looks at you with a SERIOUS face!

"well..." you start, and rub the back your head. "that MIGHT be because i AM a lot with you! NOT THAT I'M NOT ENJOYING IT OR ANYTHING!!" you clarify.

"so? where good pals! wha can't we spend time tugether?!" applejack ask's you. she HAVE a good point! but you guess everything has it's limits!

"i guess she just think that i'm spending TOO much time with you!"you say nervously and scratch the back of your head!

"well, ah think that is just STUPID!" applejack say's, a little angry and annoyed. "we should be able ya be with each other as much as we WANT!"

"ye. i guess." you say, unsure. "but maybe i AM spending too much time with you!" you say. "but i LIKE to spend time with you! i think your FUNNY and BEAUTIFUL and kind, and all kindsa stuff! me and RAINBOW DASH, always ARGUES, and she gets mad at me for EVERYTHING! ether it is, i didn't sound HONEST, when i say that she was good, or that she blows everything i say WAY out of proportions! and RARITY, said that my fashion sense, was SOMETHING TO BE DESIRED, or something.i didn't quite understand that! and PINKIE PIE! i am scared just going NEAR a kitchen she is using, or even HAVE used! and TWILIGHT is just UNBEARABLE! there's not much more to be said about that! and fluttershy... well... theres not really anything WRONG with her. but she was with TWILIGHT today, so i didn't wanna go over there!" you say

"what?" applejack asks confused "what do ya mean?"

"what?" you ask applejack

"what did ya mean by, not wanting ta go over to sluttershy, 'cause twilight was there? why would ya go over there?" applejack asked confused

"well... eeeeeeeehhhh..."
141212121.title: it's best to tell the TRUTH!

choices: "Ah've been waiting for so long t' hear ya say that."
"Sorry, sugarcube,,, but I don't feel the same way."
1413.content:
You were so close, and it was the perfect moment, too. It was a great day, you and Applejack were all alone, yet for some reason you couldn't muster up the courage to just ask her out already. Finally giving up, you say:


"You know what, never mind," you say. "It's not important."


"If it wasn't so important, then why didja need the two of us to be alone?" the confused cowpony asks.


"I don't know," you say. You then try to change the subject. "Well, I'll be inside watching Applebloom while you get your work done. I don't want to hold you up."


"Um... okay," says AJ, and she walks away towards the orchard.


As soon as the mare is out of your sight, you literally kick yourself. "Aargh, I can't believe it!" you say angrily. "How could I be so stupid!?"


"You okay?" asks a little filly from behind you. You turn around to see Applebloom.


"You wouldn't understand," you tell her.


"Ah' understand perfectly," she says. "You have a crush on my sister, but yer too scared to tell her."


You look at her in disbelief. "How did you-"


"Are you kidding me?" ask Applebloom. "It's completely obvious! And ah' can't even tell ya how painful it was ta see ya try an' ask my sister out. Why do you think Ah'm always around when you two are together? Ah' wanted to see when you'd finally come clean."


"Well, as you just saw, I totally blew it," you say.


"Ya know what yer problem is?" the filly asks. "You're focusing more on asking her out and less on simply admitting your feelings. Baby steps, [your name]. Baby steps."


You can't believe that you're taking relationship advice from a middle school pony, but she has a point.


"You know what, Applebloom, you're right," you say. "Maybe you'll get your cutie mark in relationship counselling."


The filly's face brightens up. "Really? I've got to tell the other crusaders!"


"Yeah, well just don't mention my name or Applejack's," you say, and you run off in the direction that AJ went. You see her bucking some trees in the west orchard, and you call her name.


"Sugarcube, I'm kinda busy right now," she says.


"I know, but there's something I need to say first," you say.


AJ sighs, hoping that you wouldn't just say "never mind" for the third time in a row.


"Applejack," you say, "this is something that I've been wanting to say for almost a year now. I... I like you. I really like you. I mean, you were the first friend I made in Ponyville, and you're always there for me. I think you're a really beautiful mare and you mean so much to me. If you don't like me back, I understand. I just wanted to get this off my chest."


At the end of that whole spiel, you're breathing harder than normal. What does Applejack say.
1413.title: Can't Follow Through

14132.content:
Applejack softly rubs her arm again and looks away as she just realizes what you've been trying to say. Touched, she is, but she just can't say what she needs to.

"Ah appreciative ya comin' up to me like dat, sugarcube, but... I just don't feel the same way, (your name)."

Internally, this sentence hit you hard. You try not to look dazed by her remark.

"Oh, well, that's alright, Applejack," you try to say without the strain or slowness. "I just needed to get that off my chest. At least you were honest."

Her mood lightened a bit, but still felt horrible for rejecting you like that. "Uh, (your name), look. Yere an okay guy, but Ah never though o ya as a romantic relation. Maybe its best ya find somepony else."

What she just said hit you, bad. You just confessed and she plain out just says no. Nothing to do now.

"Well, that's fine, Applejack. Maybe I should go back to watching Applebloom. She went to get her friends for... something."
You walk away from the orchard, now showing your emotion without having Applejack see. Nonetheless, she saw you walk away with some regret, and is even shocked to see the tear drop falling down from your concealed face from your hair. Once you were out of view back at her house, you wipe off the tears coming down your face. You haven't cried since Gilda punched your face in the 6th grade.

Anyway, you decides to text the other ponies that you'll help them in asap when done with each other, whoever's closest. And once again, another bundle of texts.

Rainbow Dash: Well, alright. I can wait.

Pinkie: Yay! You'll really LOVE this recipe!

Rarity: Why, thank you, (your name). I hope to meet you soon.

Twilight: Okay... I'll see you then, (your name), and remind me to ask you just what was your little "engagement" later, okay?

Again, you can't help but feel that Rarity's text was somewhat pleading you to come first, and that Twilight is going through confusion and then curiosity. Nevertheless, the only places nearby, now that you got off the farm, is the Sugarcube Corner and the Carousel Boutique. Who to go to first..?
14132.title: Rejection

choices: ...like she's been quite busy with her work.
141321.content:
While it seems like Rarity really wants you to visit her, you decide to put a trip to Carousel Boutique on hold and go to Sugarcube Corner instead. All Pinkie Pie wants is for you to test a new muffin recipe. How long would that take? Looking back on it now, you could've just went to Pinkie's first and then go to Sweet Apple Acres. Oh, well. What's done is done.


After about ten minutes of walking, you finally make it to Sugarcube Corner. As you walk in, you're greeted by the Cakes, as well as a certain pink fluffy-maned pony.


"Ohmygodyou'rehere!" she says quickly. "Iwasworriedthatyouweren'tgonnashowupbutIguesstherewasnothingtobeworried aboutcauseyou'rehere!!!"


"Okay, okay," you say. "Relax, Pinkie. So, you said that you had a new muffin recipe for me to try out, right?"


"Yesiree!" she exclaims, and she pulls you into the kitchen. She puts on some mittens and takes the muffins out of the oven. "I've been keeping them warm in case you were able to show up!"


"Way to think ahead," you say, taking a muffin from the tray. You take a bite and chew the pastry slowly so you can really taste it, and then your eyes widen.


"Pinkie, these are amazing!" you say. "The best ones yet!"


"Really, great!" she says. "I'm throwing a big end-of-the-school-year dance party in two weeks, and I wanted to make an awesome recipe."


"Well, I say you did it," you say. "I gotta go. Rarity asked me to help her with something."


"Okay. Have fun!" says Pinkie.


You wave goodbye and make your way to the Carousel Boutique. You knock on the door and you hear a voice say "Come in," from the inside. You walk in and see Rarity working on some outfits. You also see that she looks...
141321.title: Taste Testing

1413212.content:
The minute you saw her, you felt somewhat guilty you didn't come earlier. Rarity's usual hairstyle is now completely ruffled, her matching dress is completely rumpled, and she has the very tired look that is extremely conspicuous that even makeup can't hide it.

She's going back and forth, switching the pieces of cloth to see if they match up to each other. You put a hand on her shoulder and she calms down.

"Are you okay, Rarity?" you ask the unicorn.

"(Yawn) No, I'm fine, darling," she replies, "haven't slept in a solid 3 days, but I'm managing." She yawned again, this time, leaning onto you after she turned around. You start to find this a bi embarrassing, but at least you consider yourself lucky that Sweetie Belle isn't here.

"Oh, (your name)!" Rarity suddenly exclaims. She comes to her senses and realizes that she more cuddling instead of leaning. This was enough to make her blush and walk back a bit.

"I read you needed help, not sleep, but if you want, I can help spruce up the place while you sleep. And by the look of it, you especially need one."

"You'd really do that? Thank you, (your name)." She hugs you again, you hugging back this time.

"Dont worry; I just hope I can make up for almost skipping out."

"It's (yawn) okay, darling. But before I go, um, can I, err..." She trailed off and started blushing again. Rarity walks away for a bit before you try to resume her question.

"Yes, Rarity?"

"I just wanted to say, err... do you..?"

"Yeah..?"

"... want to, per se, go out on... a date, with me?" 'There I said it! I just hope it wasn't something I'll regret.' Rarity thought.

This se you back. First it was confessing to Applejack, then trying to let you down gently, and now this?

"You, want to go out with... me? Out of all people, me?" Now it was your turn to blush.

"Oh, (your name), darling, perhaps, I was a bit too early or quick to start with, but if you don't want to, I can completely understand," Rarity explains, rather quickly. But you couldn't say no. You remember AJ rejecting you and you cried... For a bit.

Since this is Rarity, and you know how dramatic she can be, you had to say...

"Sure."

Her face brightens up when you accepted her request. "Would you really!? Oh, darling!"

You weren't expecting it, and neither was she, but the unicorn just so happens to plant a soft, yet somewhat forceful, and oddly inviting, kiss on your lips. Of course, this was both of your first kisses. She took no hesitation to hug you either as you do so as well. For a good minute, you two stopped making out. Your foreheads touched as your eyes get lost with Rarity's.

"Here, why don't I walk you to your room?"

"Oh, thank you, (your name)." As you walk, you see a clutter nearly everywhere. This might take a while.

Once you read her room, Rarity lets go of your arm. "I'll see you later." Sh then kisses your cheek and closes the door. While you rub that cheek, you were lost, until you trip with a discarded spool.

Meanwhile, the unicorn looks so happy, that she falls down and fainted, both of tirednesst and elation. You both fell at the same time so none of you suspected a thing.



After 15 minutes of organizing everything, you realize that you still have other chores to do, Rainbow Dash and Twilight with Fluttershy. Which pony, which pony?
1413212.title: Exhaustion then bliss

choices: Tell her, she deserves to know.
Don't tell her. It's none of her business.
14132122.content:
You finally get everything cleaned up, and you then you decide to go see Twilight and Fluttershy. But... you can't just leave, then again, you don't want to wake Rarity, either. You decide to write a note and leave it on her bedside. You quickly find a pen and paper and scribble the message. You then walk up to Rarity's room and slowly open the door. She looked so peaceful as she slept, and you're glad that she's finally getting some rest. You quietly walk to the unicorn's nightstand, place the note and hold it in place with the lamp that was on the nightstand. The note read:


"Dear Rarity,

I had to run, Twilight and Fluttershy need me to help them tend to the animals. I was able to get all the cleaning done, so you don't have to worry about a thing. We can work out the details of our date later.

Sweet dreams,
[Your name]"


You still wonder if writing "Dear Rarity" and "Sweet dreams" was necessary, but you decided to write both because Rarity would like stuff like that. Before you turn tail and leave, you take another look at Rarity. She looked so... serene, especially in her face. Even though she looked so tired and stressed just a while ago, she somehow looks really beautiful. Maybe.... maybe Applejack really wasn't the one for you...


You immediately push that thought out of your head and leave Rarity to sleep in peace.


On your way to Fluttershy's, you get a text from Rainbow Dash. The text reads:


"No need to come over to the track, I was able to find somepony else to help me."


Well, this means that Fluttershy's cottage will be your last stop before heading home. You check the time, and it's five in the evening. You hope that the two mares you're going to see haven't already finished what they had to do. You finally get to the cottage, and when you open the door, you see Fluttershy and Twilight trying to get Angel Bunny to eat his dinner.


"Oh, thank goodness!" says Fluttershy as you walk in.


"Hey, guys," you say. "So should I just help get the other animals settled?"


"Oh no, that;s already taken care of," says the yellow coated pegasus. "It's Angel Bunny that's the problem."


You then realize why she asked Twilight to come and help her. You always knew Angel Bunny was a handful. You sometimes wondered why Fluttershy even puts up with him. Apparently, even Twilight and all her knowledge can't fix this situation, so you walk up to Angel Bunny and kneel down in front of him.


"Eat," you say, as to push the bowl of food in front of him, and Angel does just that. It seems like you're the only person that Angel isn't a total prick to.


"I knew you could do it," Fluttershy says joyfully. Twilight just rolls her eyes, as if she were saying "It's not that big a deal."


"Can I talk to you outside?" the unicorn asks you.


"Sure..." you say wearily.


When the two of you were outside and out of earshot, Twilight starts talking.


"So what took you so long?" she asks with a sassy tone.


"Well, I had other friends that needed me to help them, too, so I helped them on my way over here," you say, trying not to retaliate to Twilight's tone.


"Uh-huh," she says. "So what was this 'previous engagement' that you told me about?"


"Pretty much what I just told you," you say.


"And you expect me to believe that?" she asks.


"For Celestia's sake, Twilight!" you say, finally snapping. "Why do you have to be like that? Ever since I moved here almost three years ago you've been like this. What's your damage?"


"What's YOUR damage?" she asks back. "Why are you always keeping secrets from me? We used to tell each other everything, and now the only pony you confide in is Celestia!"


Now you see what's going on. Twilight was jealous of Auntie Celeste. You always thought that Twilight wouldn't be able to understand the problems you've had these past few years, so you always turned to your "Aunt" for advice (being a royal princess and all). Maybe you should just tell her about what happened with Applejack and Rarity...
14132122.title: Tending to the Creatures

141321221.content:
You realize that its best that she knew about what you've been going through and of the past times. After all, she is your sister-figure, like how Celestia is your aunt one.

You sigh. "Okay, fine. I guess I can tell you why I was late this time. But please, don't be ongoing with many comments, please."

'This is a first,' Twilight thought. "Alright. So what happened?"

"As usual, I was helping out Applejack by watching Applebloom, because of my crush on her which you already knew. I tried to ask her out, only to chicken out and have the filly give me advice."

You heard a stifled giggle, but you knew she realizes the harm in this. It's just like you when you thought a tardy letter to Celestia was a bit dramatic, but now, even you call Anutie Celeste for lessons you learned every now and then.

"Anyway, I went to Rarity's after that. Really worked up, says she hasn't slept for a solid three days."

"Well, you know her already," Twilight states, "always being here and there. You are apparently the only one she actually looks for to judge her designs."

"Yeah, you wouldn't believe it," you inaudibly whisper. "But this time, she wanted to ask me something. You probably might not believe it, but she did."

"What? Ask you out?" Twilight asks. Then she chuckled a bit just before she sees your blushing face. "Wait. You're not kidding?"

"Gladly, I accepted her request, maybe because I was in need of help or it just didn't seem right to say no. But--" You were interrupted by your phone ringing. You were especially surprised to see that it is...
141321221.title: It could make up for the years before

1413212211.content:
"Hello?" you answer as you pick up the phone.


"[Your name], darling!" says the mare on the other end. "How are you?"


"I'm fine, Rarity," you say. "Shouldn't you be getting some rest?"


"I was, doctor," she says sarcastically, "but I opened my eyes for just a little bit and I saw your note. I appreciate you leaving one for me."


"No problem," you say. "I mean, I didn't want to wake you, but I didn't want to leave without saying goodbye, either."


"I totally understand, darling," she says. "So, can you swing by the boutique sometime tomorrow? I'd like to work out the details of our date."


"Sure," you say.


"Great!" she says in delight. "I'll see you then!"


"Alright, bye," you say, as you hang up the phone.


"What did she say?" Twilight asks you.


"She asked if I could stop by her house tomorrow to talk about our date," you explain. "Tomorrow's Saturday, so I can just go whenever."


"Well, I think it's nice that you're giving Rarity a chance," she says. "It's better than feeling bad about AJ not returning your feelings." She then covers her mouth. "Oh, sorry. I didn't mean to put it like that."


"Nah, I understand what you meant," you say. "I just don't know if I'll get over Applejack, and I don't want to be in a relationship with somepony if I still have feelings for somepony else."


"Well, who knows?" Twilight asks. "Maybe you'll get over AJ sooner than you think."


"Maybe..." you say, unsure of that.


The next day, at around eleven-thirty in the morning, you head out to go to the Carousel Boutuque. On your way there, though, you bump into somepony. Who is it?
1413212211.title: Rarity

choices: "...we should just keep it simple. It is just our first date, after all."
14132122111.content:
You should've been watching where you were going instead of having your head in the clouds. You were so busy thinking about your upcoming date with Rarity, that you bump into somepony that was walking in the opposite direction.


"Oh man, I'm so sorry! I wasn't looking where I was... Applejack?" you say.


"Oh, it's you, sugarcube," she says uneasily.


The two of you stand there silently for about five seconds, then you speak up.


"So what brings you to this part of town?" you ask.


"Oh, ah was just stoppin' by Sugarcube Corner to grab me a bite o' Pinkie's new muffin recipe," she says, still feeling uneasy. "Really good, those muffins..."


"Yeah, I know," you say. "I had one yesterday after I... after I left your place."


The two of you are silent again. This time, AJ speaks up.


"Well, why're you in this neck o' the the woods, partner?" she asks.


"Oh, I was just headed over to Rarity's," you ask. "She needed my help with something."


It hurt you to lie to Applejack, but you can't tell her that you were planning a date with Rarity after you confessed to AJ less than twenty-four hours ago.


"Oh, alright 'den," says the cowpony. She then twiddles her fingers for a moment. "Yer not sore with me about rejectin' ya yesterday, are ya?"


"Nah," you say. "Like I said, it's okay if you don't like me back. That's life, right? I just have to try and move on. You don't need to worry about me."


You wish that it were okay, and you wish that AJ had nothing to worry about, but it was, and she did. You can't bring yourself to tell her that, though, so you just play it off.


"Well, that's nice t' hear," she says. "Ah'll see ya later."


"Later," you say, as you continue on towards the Carousel Boutique. Unbeknownst to you, Applejack was watching you as you walked off, with a look of regret on her face.


You finally reach the boutique and receive the usual greeting from Rarity, only with a kiss on the cheek added at the end.


"So darling," she says. "I've been thinking about our date, and was thinking..."
14132122111.title: Awkward...

141321221112.content:
Wow. "This is a first. Are you sure about that?" you ask.

"Oh, don't worry, (your name)," Rarity replies, "I can live with being simple if it means being with you."

"I don't mind the whole etiquette shtick, albeit a little due to the others who are so judgmental, but who am I to do so on them, right?"

She giggles a bit. "Well then, it's a good thing I'm here." Rarity then hugs you and you hug back. You see that you can actually get over Applejack. Just give it a week or so and you're off.

Still, you can't help but feel the awkwardness back at your collision with her earlier. It seems that she's hiding something from you.

And by now, Rarity notices you being deep in thought. "Something the matter, darling?"

You pushed away your thoughts. "Oh, yeah, I'm fine; just thinking."

"About what, (your name)?" The curiosity and worry is conspicuous here. You had no idea she cared so much about you like this.

"Its a bit complicated, Rarity. I just hope it doesn't turn out bad later on..."

"If you have a problem, I can probably help you, darling."

You weren't sure about telling Rarity about your confession to Applejack is a good thing right now. But she will soon realize it so you decided its better to let her know now.

"Well, alright. (Sigh) Yesterday at Applejack's, I was helping her out watching Applebloom. I horribly confessed to AJ about a little crush I had. But after she somewhat let me down gently, I went to Pinkie's, came here, then helped Fluttershy afterwards. I didn't know you felt this way, but I didn't want to hurt your feelings either. I'm over Applejack now, but something seems funny."

"Like what?"

"We accidentally bumped into each other just before I came here. Very awkward situation, I'll give it that, but I couldn't help but notice that she acted a little off today. I told her it was okay about yesterday, but I can't quite place what is wrong."

Rarity thinks for a second. "You don't suppose she's... jealous now, do you?"

"Applejack didn't have the same feelings for me. I can't put jealousy in that category. Besides, she doesn't even know about us, so she has nothing to be jealous about."

"Hmm, well, I hope things work out right soon. Maybe we can talk to her later."

"I suppose I can--" Suddenly your phone rings. Who's the call from?
141321221112.title: Plain and simple

choices: "I don't think that's a good idea..."
1413212211122.content:
"You should probably get that," says Rarity.


You take your phone out of your pocket and answer without looking to see who's calling. Because of this, you were surprised to hear the voice on the other end after you said hello.


"Heya, [your name]..." she says. "Ah know we just bumped into each other just a while ago, but ah was wonderin' if... if ah could talk to ya in person when yer done with helpin' Rarity out."


The only thing you could think to say was "Okay."


"Alright 'den," she says. "Ah'll be waitin' at Sweet Apple Acres. Bye."


The line goes dead. You begin to sense your feelings for Applejack coming back again. Could this mean that you still have a chance with her? What about Rarity then? Can you live with yourself if you just go with Applejack and leave Rarity in the rain (metaphorically speaking), especially when she was looking forward to this date so much. You're in a real jam.


Rarity looks at you and reads you like a book. "That wasn't Applejack, was it?" she asks. You nod your head in response. "She wants me to meet her at her place to talk," you explain. "Maybe I should just tell her everything. You don't mind if I bring you along, do you?"


What does Rarity say?
1413212211122.title: A Meeting Proposal

choices: she is a bit uneasy with everyone being there with you.
14132122111221.content:
"Really?" you ask.

"I have nothing else to do," Rarity replies, "so, I might as well spend the day with you, (your name)."

"Alright. Thanks, Rarity."

As you both walk off to Sweet Apple Acres, you were suddenly jumped by Applebloom on the trail, nearly giving you a heart attack.

"And to who does he owe this to, Applebloom?" Rarity asks.

"Ah don't know," the fully innocently replies, "but ah would like ta know why he hangin' 'round wit' ya, Rarity."

"Just a friendly visit," you reply.

"Sure... So, wha' happened wit' Applejack?"

"Don't ask." She snickers somewhat loud as she follows you to meet Applejack. After all, she just said talk in person, never about privacy. Once you meet up with the cowpony...
14132122111221.title: "Sure, why not."

141321221112212.content:
You finally meet up with Applejack in her room, where she was waiting for you. At first, she seems happy to see you, but then she sees Applebloom and Rarity.


"Umm... [your name]," she says, "Ah'd prefer if we talked alone."


"Oh, okay," you say, then you turn to Rarity and Applebloom. "You guys don't mind, do you?"


"Not at all, darling," says Rarity.


"Whaaaat?" whines Applebloom.


"Come along, little filly," says Rarity, as she pulls Applebloom aside. With the two extra guests out of the room, AJ sighs and sits on her bed. She taps the space to her left, signaling for you to sit next to her, which you do.


"Okay Applejack," you say with a smile. "What's up."


"There's somethin' ah really want to tell ya," she says, struggling to even look at you. "Somethin' you deserve to hear."


"What do you mean?" you ask.


Applejack then turns to you and looks you in the eyes, with tears welling up in hers. "[Your name], ah'm really sorry for rejectin' ya like that," she says. "Someone like you didn't deserve that. It's just... I didn't know what else to say."


"Like I keep saying, AJ, it's fine," you say. "If you don't like me, you don't have to feel guilty."


"That's the thing, sugarcube," she says. "It's not that I don't like ya, because... because I..."


"Wait, you like me back?" you ask.


"Yes, and ah've wanted to tell ya for a while, but I was too scared," she says. "When you confessed ta me yesterday, I was really happy, but I was also a might scared, because I didn't think it was the right time, and I was never expectin' ya t' make the first move, so... I'm sorry."


You were in shock. You had no Idea that AJ liked you back, let alone was nervous about you confessing to her. You start to understand why she did what she did.


"So... now that that's off mah chest," she says. "Why didja bring Rarity here witcha?"


"Well, I told her that I was headed here after I was done helping her and she wanted to come along," you say.


"Do ya mind if I ask what you were helpin' her with?" she asks.


"Oh, just helping her with dresses and stuff. She needed a second opinion on her latest designs." you say. Again, it hurts you to lie to AJ, but telling her that you were planning a date with Rarity would not only break her heart, but it would also make her pretty mad.


What does Applejack say?
141321221112212.title: Some Privacy, Please?

choices: Hmm, somewhat okay, since most of this is her fault anyway.
Oh... well, as said before, hell hath no fury like a woman scorn.
1413212211122122.content:
Applejack has a skeptical look on her face that you know says she doesn't believe you.

"Sure, ah can see dat," the cowpony replies, "but tell me what else happened."

"What do you mean, Applejack?" You're screwed.

"Ah know yer hidin' somethin there, (your name). It wasn't just ta help Rarity out, was it?"

"What do you mean?"

"Please, don't give me dat, sugarcube. Ah've known ya long 'nough ta know yer lying to me. What did you two do?"

You realize it was pointless to try and procrastinate the inevitable. You might as well just come clean now to save you probably months of avoidance from one of your best pony friends.

"Fine, you got me." You stand up from the bed to not look at Applejack. "Rarity asked me out yesterday," you say rather quickly. As soon as you said that, you heard a slight gasp.

"She... what?"

"Rarity asked me out, Applejack. And by her nervousness, I can tell it was a long time crush as well."

Unbeknownst to anyone, Applebloom went with the crusaders after they conveniently coincidentally came by, Rarity was near the door, listening to their every word.

"I know you saw that tear drop I accidentally made yesterday, but you know how emotional I can get. I didn't want to break Rarity's heart since you know how she can get. And with knowing how that affected me, I had to accept her request. Wait..."

Taking out your phone with a hunch, you realize that Rarity fills up most of the history of contacts made, next to Applejack. You even checked the list of messages and see that it was a little hinting about her crush.

Hell, you even remember Rarity with Pinkie Pie once in the kitchen. Now you know who the cake was from on your last birthday.

"I... She did all that... and I couldn't see it..."

How does Applejack take it?
1413212211122122.title: She can see through you...

choices: Just let her release her emotions.
14132122111221221.content:
Applejack takes a long sigh and just stares at the ground. "So Rarity likes ya, and yer goin on a date with her..." she says.


"Yeah," you say. "I'm sorry."


"No, it's my fault," she says. "Ah had my chance and ah blew it. You's think that ah'd be honest with ya, 'cause it's my element an' all. I just could't bring myself to..." It was at this point that Applejack's voice was beginning to crack. "Now that yer goin' out with Rarity, it's too late fer me to fix it." The cowpony was now in tears, covering her face with her hands as she sobs softly.


An intense pang of guilt comes over you. Even though none of this was your fault, you still felt somehow responsible. You at least owe it to her to try and comfort Applejack.


"AJ," you say. "Please stop crying."


"Ah can't," she sniffles. "Ah kept stalling for so long, and now it's too late."


Meanwhile, Rarity is still listening in on you two, having heard every word that was said. She feels more guilty than you do. One of her best friends had a crush on you and she didn't even notice because of her own feelings for you. She starts to regret asking you on that date.


Back in AJ's room, you're still trying to figure out what to do to get the cowpony to stop crying. What do you do?
14132122111221221.title: Drowning in Sorrow

141321221112212211.content:
You were on the verge of tears as well. You can't stand having to have your best pony friend in depression all because of actions made. The guilt was eating you up, but no matter what you tried, AJ just wouldn't budge.

By this time, Rarity had enough. She knew she had to do something and it has to happen now.

She comes into the room, giving both of you a shock.

"Rarity!?"

"How long have you been standing there?" you ask.

"Enough to hear every word, darling. But, Applejack..." She walks over to AJ.

"Rarity... Ah'm sorry ya have t' see me like this."

"No, Applejack. This is my fault, too. I had no idea you felt this strongly for (your name) as well. I just got caught up with my emotions and felt that I had to do so."

"At least you confessed. Ah mean, jus' look at me!" the cowpony exclaims. Rarity was also starting to tear up.

"Applejack, look. I know you want to be with him, so why don't you two go with each other later tonight?"

"What!?" you both exclaim.

"But, Rarity, are you sure?" you ask. "I mean, I don't want to hurt you or anything, but..."

Rarity manages to smile. "Its okay, darling. I can understand." For the element of Generosity, you really had to give her credit for that.

AJ thinks it over and looks at Rarity.
141321221112212211.title: Consolation can (almost) get anywhere

1413212211122122112.content:
After mulling it over for a bit, Applejack looks up at Rarity.


"Ya know what?" she says, "Ah have an idea. Now, this may seem a might strange, but bear with me on this... How about we BOTH go out with [your name] tonight."


Both you and Rarity are taken aback by this idea, firstly at the idea itself, secondly at the fact that it was AJ's idea.


"You're not serious, are you darling?" asks Rarity.


"Why not?" the cowpony asks back. "It'll be fun, won't it? Sorta like a double date."


"Hardly," you think. "Then again, why should I complain? If Rarity agrees, I'll be going on a date with two amazing mares at the same time!"


"Well, I really don't see anything wrong with it..." says Rarity. After thinking it over for another second, her face brightens up. "Why not?" she asks. "Where should we go?"


"Ah reckon we should let the boy taking us out decide that," Applejack says, her usual spunk coming back into her voice. The two mares then turn their attention to you, leaving you to decide where to go right on the spot.


"Uhmm..." you say. "Maybe we could..."
1413212211122122112.title: Double Date (Sort of...)

14132122111221222.content:
You're so busy looking at all the text messages that Rarity sent you, that you don't even notice how mad Applejack's getting. You put your phone back in your pocket, and look up at AJ to see the infuriated look on her face.


She gets up in a huff. "I can't believe 'dat stuck up, man-stealin', good fer nothin'-"


"Whoa, whoa, whoa," you say. "How is this her fault?"


"She has the nerve ta ask you out when I like you too!" she yells.


"Well, did she know that you liked me?" you ask.


"Well... ah didn't actually tell her..." she says, calming down a little, "but she should've known."


"She didn't get her cutie mark in mind reading," you say.


"Why in the hay are you defendin' her?" she asks, directing her anger at you. "Aren't I the one you like?"


"That doesn't mean I have to side with you all the time," you say. "Part of the reason why I like you is because I thought that you were more level-headed than this. I guess I thought wrong."


Applejack's eyes widen as she hears what you just said. She immediately calms down, a tear running down her face.


"Ah... ah'm sorry, sugarcube..." she says. “You must be pretty sore with me..."


"Well, I was for a second..." you say, "but I can't stay mad at you."


Applejack smiles warmly at you, felling much better now that you've forgiven her. After wiping her eyes, AJ rushes at you, wrapping you in a tight hug. After having you stuck in her embrace for a while...
14132122111221222.title: A Mare's Scorn

142.content:
"I'll get Apple Bloom for you," you say. "The other ponies asked me to help them out today, as well, so I could take Apple Bloom with me while you focus on getting all that extra work done."


"Well, that's mighty nice of ya, partner," she says. "Ah wouldn't want mah little sis cooped up in the house all afternoon, especially on a Friday."


"What are friends for?" you say, resisting the urge to cringe at the word "friends." Will that be all you'll ever be to AJ? You hope not. She's such an amazing pony, the mare of your dreams, even. It would really suck if all you ever are to her is just a friend.


"In that case, Ah'll head out to the orchards and get to work," says Applejack. "Ah have a long day ahead of me."


"Don't push yourself too hard, though," you say.


"When have Ah ever pushed myself too hard?" she asks, but then she quickly says "Don't answer dat question." When she passes you on her way out the house, her mane brushes your face slightly, and you catch a whiff of its sweet scent. After enjoying the aroma, you go upstairs to get Apple Bloom. When you reach her room, you knock on her door, and she opens it.


"[Your name]!" she says. "You're here!"


"Yep," you say. "So, you wanna go out into town? I'm gonna be helping the other ponies."


"That'd be great!" she says, and you both head out.


As you two are walking, Apple Bloom decides to strike up a conversation.


"Ah've been wonderin'," she says. "How come you visit Sweet Apple Acres so often?"


"To see Applejack," you answer bluntly, not wanting her to know that you have a crush on her older sister.


"Ah know that," she says, "but why do you live to visit mah big sis so much?"


"Well, next to Twilight, she's the closest friend I have," you explain. "When I first moved here, I was picked on a lot for being the only human in the whole town, and she was the first of my classmates to actually show me kindness. We've been friends ever since."


"Oh, Ah see," she says, finally dropping the subject.


So, who do you and Apple Bloom visit first?
142.title: Foalsitting

1422.content:
To finish one wuick little thing, you decided to go to the Sugercube Corner first. "So Applebloom," you start, "how do you feel about taste testing something Pinkie Pie made?"

Her ears perk up. "You think I can get my cutie mark doing so?" Her and her obsession with cutie marks... You remember the time she had the "Cutie Mark Pox", or something like that. You'd think that she'd learn her lesson after that, but the Crusaders are still at it. Even her cousin, Babs Seed, is going through with this.

"Maybe, but as I keep saying, I don't expect it as much as you do, but I'm still rooting for you, Applebloom. I don't know why, but I feel that you're gonna get yours sooner than what I think."

You looked at Applebloom and could've sworn she just blushed. You looked away just before she looks at you. With a shy look, the blush slowly goes away, just before she realized that she was very close to swooning, minus the hand gesture. It was too late to see that when Applebloom leaned too far and fell.

"Whoa! Oof!"

"Applebloom! Are you okay?" You grab her hand and try to pull her up but it was backfired, since you used too much strength by overestimating her weigh, and you end up falling back, bringing the filly down, with her being on top, thus creating a very awkward scene.

She was nearly hugging you, head buried on your shoulder. Applebloom gets up with a blush on her face. You had one as well, much redder and bigger than hers.

"Sorry, Applebloom," was all you could say.

"I am fine now though..." she replies. You were both in the moment, but you didn't know what to do. Kiss her right now, or hurt her feelings?

Your questions were answered when...
1422.title: But on the way there...

14221.content:
She jumped at you, her lips locked with you. You were so surprised that your hand automatically embraced her during her kissing. Several seconds later she broke her kiss and then blushed heavily.

"Apple Bloom?" you asked her a question.

"I am.. I just." she stumbled, continued her blushing.

As if someone decided to play a cruel prank at you, you noticed that Pinkie Pie had been grinning at you. "Great, that's exactly what I need right now," you mumbled to yourself.

"Huh," Apple Bloom looked quizzically at you.

"Behind you sweetie," you gave her a hint. Quickly Apple Bloom looked behind herself and noticed Pinkie Pie grinning at both of you. Fear froze her body.

"I've seen nothing," replied Pinkie Pie her grin still had been placed on her face. "So what can I do for you two lovebirds."

"Ice cream," Apple Bloom stuttered. "Ice cream would be just fine."

"Two ice creams coming right up."

"Um Pinkie?" you decided to grab her attention

"We will talk later bad boy, if that's okay with you," she had replied at you winking

You nodded at her, and then allowed Pinkie leave to your privacy.

"Apple Bloom ... So, since we were interrupted by the demon herself, care to explain that?"

"Oh that," she replied. "I just ... I just have a crash on you that's all.

"Apple Bloom I like Applejack," you replied to her bluntly

"I know that."

"No, I mean I really like Applejack," you decided to clarify.

"Well can't you really like me too."

"I... I just don't know."

The desire was there, partially you really wanted to get down and dirty with Apple Bloom but at the same time you still wanted to date Applejack.

"That's okay.. um, we can always continue it later if you want."

"Right, " you replied awkwardly.

You decided to
14221.title: Applebloom kisses you first.

choices: Let her down gently (for Celestia's sake, GENTLY!).
14222.content:
"Whoa! What's going on here," says somepony. The voice sounds very deep and threatening, and you nearly piss your pants. You look up and see Pinkie Pie standing over you and Apple Bloom.


"Just kidding!" she says. "Didja like my deep stallion voice?"


"Not funny," you say. "This isn't what it looks like, by the way."


"I know, sillies!" she says. "I saw you when you tried to pick Apple Bloom up off of the ground. I guess you don't know your own strength!"


"I guess not," you say, as the young filly gets off of you and you get up on your feet. "So, you wanted me to taste test a new recipe of yours?"


"That's right!" says Pinkie. "And now I have two taste testers since you brought Apple Bloom along with you!" She leads you and Apple Bloom to Sugarcube Corner, where the muffins were waiting. You and Apple Bloom sit at the table and you each pick up a muffin. After taking a taste, both of you pause for a moment, then wolf down your respective muffins.


"That was amazin'!" says Apple Bloom. "The best muffin Ah ever tasted!"


"Same here!" you say.


"Oh you guys," says Pinkie Pie. "You really think so?"


"We know so!" you say. "These are gonna be a hit!"


"Well thanks for testing them for me!" she says. "So, where are you two headed now?"


"Everypony's asked me for help today, and the next closest place is the school track, where Rainbow Dash wants me to help her train for the final track meet of the year," you say.


"Well, tell Dashie hi for me!" she says.


"Will do, Pinkie," you say, and you and Apple Bloom leave Sugarcube Corner.


On your way to the school track, you look at Apple Bloom, who is still blushing at what happened between you two earlier. It's a good thing Pinkie interrupted you, because you had a feeling that Apple Bloom wanted to kiss you, which would have been way wrong. You're a junior in high school, and she's in the seventh grade, but apparently that doesn't matter to her. Then again, everypony's been through that point in their lives where they've had an unrealistic crush on someone older than them. Hell, even you had a crush on Cadance back when she used to babysit you and Twilight, and the age gap between you and her (seven years) is bigger than the age gap between you and Apple Bloom (four years). It's obvious that Apple Bloom is into you, but you like her older sister. If she were a couple years older, then maybe, you'd consider it.


So, this begs the question: what are you gonna do about this? You can't just string the poor filly along, but you don't want to crush her heart, either. What to do?
14222.title: Even More Awkward

choices: "... it was just the moment. Nothing else, Ah swear!"
"... it's because, I have a really big crush on ya!" She hugs you...
142221.content:
You had time to spare before reaching the school track, so you decided to talk to Apple Bloom about what happened between you two back there.

"So, uh, Apple Bloom..?" you try to say.

"Yeah, (your name)?" she replies, looking away from you and rubbing her cheek.

"You do know that was an accident back there, right?"

"Huh? Oh, sure, Ah knew dat." There was that awkward pause that you knew couldn't be beared.

"Well, back there, it looked like..."

"Yes, (your name)?"

"... like, err, you wanted to... kiss me..."

"Well, sur-- I mean, err, what do ya mean?"

You stopped for a minute and Apple Bloom does the same. You thought you heard something, but as usual, when that happens, you let it go. Sometimes people just stutter, you tell yourself.

"It was the moment before Pinkie Pie interrupted. You were kinda leaning down and somewhat closing your eyes."

You saw her blush getting redder as you knew she was about to crack, without you having any reason to do anything with.

"What? Ya must've been imaginin' things, (your name). Ah mean, sure, it was a bit awkward 'dere, but what do you mean, 'Ah tried to kiss ya'?"

"Apple Bloom, I'm not scolding you, or anything like that. I just want to know, did you really want to kiss me?"

She knew that there was no getting out of this. So she decided to come clean. "(Sigh) A'right, fine. Ah-- Ah, really did want to kiss ya."

Your blush became as red as hers. "Oh, well--"

"Ah tried t' stop mahself, and Ah really hated it when Pinkie Pie interrupted..."

You were at an extreme loss for words. "But, why, Apple Bloom..?"

"Well..."
142221.title: At least talk to her about it first

1422211.content:
“It was just the moment, nothing else! Ah swear!” she says frantically.


“It’s fine, Apple Bloom,” you say. “I was just wondering.” What the young filly said was pretty understandable. She’s thirteen, so she’s at that age where she doesn’t have a full understanding of her feelings. It’s also the age where most ponies get their cutie marks, according to your experiences with ponies in middle school, at least. However, something tells you that Apple Bloom isn’t being completely honest with you.


The rest of the walk is rather quiet, but thankfully it only took about three minutes to get to the school track from where you guys stopped. When you get there, you see Rainbow Dash doing some warm ups.


“Hey, [your name]! And Apple Bloom, too!” says the pegasus.


“Yep,” you say. “AJ wants me to keep an eye on her, so I decided to take her along with me as I help everypony out.”


“Well, that’s cool,” she says. “I’ve already done some flying training with the rest of the team, but I’d like you guys to help me train for the running events.” It’s at that point where you notice that Rainbow Dash is wearing one of those braces that pegasus track runners wear to keep them from using their wings to give them a speed boost.


You’ve helped Rainbow train, before. You have a record of her best lap, her best overall time, and the time averages for all the school teams in the district. Dash gives you her stop watch and you and Apple Bloom set up the hurdles on the track while the pegasus gets herself pumped up at the starting line. Once the hurdles are set, you and Apple Bloom signal her to get ready.


“On your mark…” you say.


“Get set…” says the filly.


“GO!!” you both say simultaneously, and Rainbow Dash takes off. Apple Bloom operated the stopwatch while you use your phone to pull up an updated average sheet. After Rainbow does her laps, Apple Bloom lets her know how she did.


“You started to get a might slow in laps five, six, and seven, but then ya really kicked it into gear for the last three laps.”


“With that in mind,” you add, “I think some endurance training will fix that.”


“In that case,” says Rainbow Dash, “I'll get right on that endurance training! Thanks, guys!”


"No problem," you say. "We're gonna head over to Rarity's place. See ya."


With that, you and Apple Bloom leave on your way to Carousel Boutique. As you two walk away, Rainbow Dash notices Apple Bloom inching closer and closer to you with each step.


"Could she really... Nah, it's nothing," she thinks, and gets back to her training.


You and the little filly finally make it to Rarity's, where the unicorn was inside waiting for you to arrive. When you knock on the door, she rushes to answer it. "Be right there!" she says. She opens the door and happily greets you with a hug.


"[Your name], darling!" she says. "How have you been?"


"You mean since I last saw you two hours ago when school let out?" you say.


"Oh, ha, ha," she says, then she notices the young filly standing next to you. "Oh, Apple Bloom! I didn't notice you there. Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo are upstairs, so you can go upstairs and play with them while [your name] helps me out with some designs."


"Oh... okay, den?" says the filly, with a somewhat disappointed tone in her voice, and she walks towards the staircase to go up to see her fellow Crusaders, leaving you and Rarity alone.


While Twilight was like your sister, and Applejack was the mare of your dreams, Rarity was your confidant. For some reason, you could trust her to keep your secrets. She has known that you liked AJ for over a year now, and she hasn't told anypony, so that's all the proof you need to know that you can confide in her,


"So, [your name]," she says...
1422211.title: She Is At That Age...

choices: "I'll try to cause the accident again!"
"Maybe I can ask Zecora to help out!"
14222112.content:
"What do you mean, Rarity?" you ask, hoping not to get on the wrong foot.

"Just when you got here, and I suggested for Apple Bloom to go and play with Sweetie Belle, she just sounded like a daughter being separated from her coltfriend!" Rarity explains. "Mind telling me what's going on?"

You didn't even know the answer either. Somehow, you feel you do, but it sounds ridiculous. "I think Apple Bloom has a crush on me," was all you could say.

Rarity wasn't expecting that response so, she started laughing uncontrollably suddenly. "Hah hah hah! Oh, Celestia, help me! (Shrill laughter)." That hurt, your ears, that is. "Crush on you!? Ha ha, ha... (Gasp, sigh) No, really."

"It's probably true. I suppose that's my fault for accidentally doing something earlier." She starts to believe you and looks at you with a curious smile, which you know will soon fade away. "Apple Bloom fell and I tried to pick her up, just to get myself falling as well. She fell on top of me and it was a very awkward scene. I could've sworn she would've kissed me right there until Pinkie Pie interrupted. I talked to her after helping Pinkie test out her muffins. Really great, I'll give it that; finished it like (snap fingers) that."

"Naturally."

"Apple Bloom sooner or later told me that it was just the moment, but I highly doubted it."

"I see. Well, you can think about that later; can you please help me with these designs? You know how indecisive I can get."

"How can I forget..?"

Meanwhile, Apple Bloom was upstairs with Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo, with the filly not paying much attention as she keeps reminiscing the scene in her head.

"Apple Bloom?" Sweetie Belle asks. But no response. "Apple Bloom?" This time, she responds.

"Are you okay, Apple Bloom?" Scootaloo asks. "You're spacing out more than usual."

"It's nothing, guys," Apple Bloom replies, "just thinkin' of somethin'."

"I can tell it's about about cutie marks."

"Well, it isn't if not, what Ah told ya a few months ago. My crush on [your name]?"

"What about it?" Sweetie Belle asks.

"Well, it was just an accident, but we both fell an' almost... kissed."

"WHAT!?" they both exclaim.

"Not so loud!" Apple Bloom whispered. "But I can tell he didn't know what to do. I think he likes somepony else."

"He can't be," Scootaloo says. "You think it was an accident?"

Apple Bloom blushed. The way they both looked during that scene. 'Oh, why did ya interrupt us, Pinkie Pie? The moment was perfect...' "Well, maybe Ah can do something to change his mind."

"Like what?"

"Hmm. Ah know! --
14222112.title: This had to come up

choices: Inside the house and up to her room.
142221121.content:
"Ah'll just try to cause the accident again!" says Apple Bloom with cheer in her voice.


"You'll have to do it when there's nopony around, so that there won't be any interruptions," says Scootaloo.


"I don't know, you guys..." says Sweetie Belle.


"What are ya talkin' about, Sweetie?" asks the southern filly. "Yer usually all for these types of romantic plans."


"I know, I know," she says, "but I think it's different this time. I mean, [your name]'s seventeen, and you're only thirteen."


"Ah'll be fourteen by the end of summer."


"But then he'll be eighteen the month after."


"Love knows no age, Sweetie Belle."


"AB's right!" says Scootaloo. "I say go for it, sister!"


"You got it!" she says with a new determination. "Ah'm gonna go downstairs and see what Rarity and [your name] are up to." The little filly sneaks down the stairs and catches wind of your conversation with Rarity. While the Cutie Mark Crusaders were upstairs, the subject of your conversation switched from Apple Boom to Applejack. However, Apple Bloom arrived in the middle of the conversation, and no names were mentioned, so she was totally in the dark as to who you and Rarity are talking about.


"You really think she's the one?" the unicorn asks.


"I'm sure of it," you say. "There's something about her that makes me like her so much. I don't know what it is. There's a lot of different things about her that I like; her positive attitude, her cute southern accent."


"Okay, okay, you don't have to give me a list."


"Cute southern accent?" Apple Bloom thinks. "He must be talking about me! I knew it! I knew we were meant to be together!" Unfortunately, she forgot about the fact that she had an older sister that's your age.


"Well, you've had a crush on her for over a year now," says Rarity. "I think you should admit your feelings. I'm sure she'd appreciate it."


"You know what?" you say. "You're right. Once I get back to Sweet Apple Acres, I'll tell her how I feel."


"There you go! That's what I like to hear!"


Apple Bloom sneaks back up the stairs, then rushes to Sweetie Belle's room to tell her friends what she heard and what (she thought) you were talking about.


After you help Rarity with her designs, you call Apple Bloom down and tell her that you're ready to go. As you two leave Carousel Boutique, Apple Bloom asks you something?


"So, are we going to Fluttershy's next?" she asks.


"That was the plan," you say, "but I talked to her and Twilight earlier and they said that they're set, so I don't need to show up. So, I guess we'll be headed back to Sweet Apple Acres."


The filly resists the urge to jump for joy, because she's expecting you to confess the feelings that she thought were towards her. Little did she know that she was in for a big surprise. When you both get back to the Apple Family home, Apple Bloom decides to put "Operation Tumble" into motion. She immediately spots a tree root on the path to the house, and she stops you just as you reach it.


"[Your name], Ah really want to thank ya fer takin' me out with ya today," she says. "It was really fun."


You turn around, the back of your foot right by the root, which you still haven't noticed. "Anytime, Apple Bloo-WHOA!!!"


Just as the filly planned, you fall backwards, the filly pretending to fall with you. You both hit the ground with a thud.


"Sorry about that," you say. "I'm really clumsy today, aren't I?"


"Ah don't mind," she says with a tone that seems rather strange to you, coming from someone like her. "So, [your name]," she says. "Is there something that you want to tell me?"


"Well, yeah," you say.


"Here it comes! I can't wait!" the filly thinks.


"I wanted to say that I had a lot of fun, too," you say. "We should do this again sometime."


Apple Bloom instinctively opened her mouth to say "I really like you, too," but stopped when she heard what you said.


"Oh... well, Ah'm lookin' forward to it." she says. "Could he have chickened out?" she thinks. "Yeah, that's gotta be it. He's been too afraid to say it for over a year, so he must have gotten scared at the last second. Well that's fine with me. Ah can wait."


The filly gets of of you, and you both walk back to the house. When you knock on the door, you're greeted by Applejack, who's wearing different clothes form before. She must have gotten her work done and took a shower afterward.


"Howdy, you two!" she says. "Did ya'll have fun?"


"Lots of fun, big sis!" says Apple Bloom.


"Oh, before I forget, AJ," you say. "Can I talk to you later? There's something I want to tell you."


Those last seven words make Apple Bloom's heart stop.


"No way," she thinks. "But when Ah heard him talking to Rarity earlier today, Ah was positive that... Oh, no! He was talkin' 'bout Applejack!? But I... I thought that... No.... No, no, no, no, no!"


"You alright, Apple Bloom?" you and AJ ask.


A tear streams down the poor young filly's face, and in a crying fit, she runs away. The question is: in which direction did she run?
142221121.title: If at First You Don't Succeed...

choices: "I cannot do so, Apple Bloom. Doing so, either way, cannot change your gloom."
"Okay, but just this one time." 'I hope I won't regret this act of mine.'
1422211212.content:
The tear confused you and Applejack, you esecially, as she darts off somewhere else.

"Apple Bloom, where're ya goin!?" her sister exclaims.

"Wait, Apple Bloom, come back!" But the filly didn't listen. She just kept running away. "Was it something I said?"

"Ah don't think so. We'd better get her quick. Who knows where she could be headed?"

But you somewhat underestimated Apple Bloom's speed and direction and so you have been wandering off trying your best to look for the filly. You even had to ask the others to help out. Unfortunately, they couldn't find her.

Reason being, she ran off into the Everfree Forest, with no intentions in mind but letting the sadness go. She was sitting near a tree root, sobbing her eyes out, mourning over the loss of her crush. She didn't even hear the rustling of a certain mare, or should I say Zebra. After a twig snapped, Apple Bloom looks up. "Who's there?"

"Hmm?" she heard. Then Zecora came out. "Ah, why it's my little friend, Apple Bloom. I do not understand; why are you in gloom?"

The filly runs to hug the zebra. "Oh, Zecora! I can't believe it! I have a cush for someone, but..."

"But why are you here with me, instead of your family?"

"My crush is [your name], and his crush is my sister, Applejack..."

"I can see now why you feel this sting. After all, as I said, love is a weird thing.
Here, let me take you to my home; maybe what you need is some time alone."

As Apple Bloom and Zecora make their way to her home, you were still wandering about to look for the filly. But no one had any luck. Until Twilight asked a few ponies and said that she was last seen entering the Everfree Forest.

Of course, this scared Fluttershy, but you somehow managed to make her come, even if her hooves are scraping the ground. 'Geez, Applajack. But I know it's understandable; after all, it's your sister.'

Apple Bloom was sitting outside of Zecora's house. Rethinking about what just happened, she just couldn't believe it. "Why, [your name], why..? I thought you meant me when you said, 'cute southern accent'... But it was Applejack you liked. Why, [your name]?"

Zecora looks at the filly outside. 'I can't stand seeing Apple Bloom this way, but I also can't believe that today was the day.
[Your name] admiting his true feelings to Applejack; but now, how will this filly ever change back?'
